loans.name: Dedicacion

texts.es:
Dedicación, de 45 años, enviudo hace dos años de su esposo Maurilio. Ambos tuvieron 5 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellas: Nora y Candí. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ricrican.
Está valerosa mujer, se dedica a la siembra de tubérculos en la variedad de, papa, oyuco y oca, lo que más le gusta a ella, son los momentos en los que puede bajar de sus terrenos agrícolas a la ciudad, donde después de cada cosecha vende sus productos alimenticios, según cuenta comercializa a muy buen precio, pues cuida con mucho esmero de sus cultivos, escogiendo siempre los frutos más buenos. Ella baja por lo menos una vez a la ciudad de Tarma, donde aparte de vender sus nutritivos tubérculos, también comercializa carne de ovino al por mayor, con la venta puede costear los alimentos de la semana y algunos imprevistos. Ella agradece a Dios, por todo el apoyo que recibió y a pesar de lo pesado que es trabajar en la chacra, está feliz de poder tener algo propio y trabajarlo para sus hijos.Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mirando a un futuro mejor” y este es el duodécimo crédito con MFP, donde seguirá trabajando para el desarrollo de su banco comunal, además; como socia antigua promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Dedicación de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales, para preveer su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
45-year-old Dedicación is a widow.  She lost her husband Maurilio two years ago.  The couple had five children but Dedicación only lives with two of them: Nora and Candí.  They live together as a family unit in their own home which is located in the town of Ricrican.

This brave woman grows tubers (potatoes, oyuco and oca).  What she most enjoys is when she is able to travel down from her farm to the city where she sells her produce after each harvest.  She tells us that she is able to sell at a very good price because she takes a lot of care of her crops, always choosing the best fruit.  She travels at least once to the city of Tarma where, in addition to selling her nutritious tubers, she also sells meat from her sheep.  These sales enable her to cover the cost of her weekly food and some other incidental expenses.

Dedicación is grateful to God for all the support that she has received and, in spite of how demanding it is working on her farm, she is happy that she owns her farm and is able to work it for her children.

Dedicación belongs to the "Mirando a un futuro mejor" community bank and this is her 12th loan from MFP.  She will continue working for the development of her bank.  As a long-standing member of her bank, Dedicación pledges to be punctual in making her loan repayments.  With your support, she will invest the money she has requested in buying several sacks of natural fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of natural fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cattle

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 41 years old and is a married woman.  She lives in the town of San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur with her family.  She farms for a living.  Shirley grows rice and corn crops on her land.  She earns about 6,000 PHP per month from farming.

Shirley has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs.  She hopes this loan will help her to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en: Laurence wants a loan to clear land and prepare it for cultivation.  He is a 38 year old farmer hailing from Kyenjojo District in Uganda and is a father of 10 children whom he lives with together with their mother in a semi-permanent house.  His dream is to educate his children and become a model farmer.

loans.use: to clear land and prepare it for cultivation.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married woman from the town of San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur.  She is 39 years old and has seven children. 

Vilma farms for a living.  She grows rice and corn crops on her land.  Vilma earns just enough to buy her family's basic needs.  She said it is difficult for her and her husband to sustain their children's education because tuition fees continue to rise.

Vilma requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.  She hopes to earn a better income and be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is a 45-year-old married woman with five children.  The oldest child is 22 years old.  Lea has been engaged in farming for 10 years.  She primarily grows rice crops to sell.  Each month, Lea earns about 8,000 PHP from farming.

Lea has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.  She hopes to have a progressive life.  She also hopes for her children to finish their studies and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses, a 21 year old hardworking man lives with his parents in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal Uganda.
This young man deals both in produce and transportation businesses and his current dream is to buy his own motorcyle for the businesses.  He has been riding someone else's motorcycle and this limits his daily income since 70% of the income has to be remitted to the owner of the motorcycle.  He needs the Kiva loan to buy a new motrcycle for transportation purposes.

loans.use: to buy a new motrcycle for transportation purposes.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity, a 38-year-old single woman, has three children and lives in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her major dream is to educate her children to the university level. 

Charity has a poultry project that she has run for five years. Her major challenge has always been inadequate money to buy enough feed. She needs the loan to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando, de 40 años, convive con Guadalupe, su esposa. Ambos tienen un hijo: Cristian, de 14 años de edad. En unión familiar los tres viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad de Tarma.Hace 16 años, esté trabajador hombre se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, ovino, vacuno y porcino; el cual enseba y mata, para luego comercializarlo en su carnicería que con esfuerzo y mucha dedicación adquirió en el mercado modelo de su ciudad; los días de mayor venta son los jueves y domingos. Pero no solo a ello se dedica Rolando, él también incursionó hace 3 años, al trasporte público, cubriendo las rutas de Tarma - Palcamayo, obteniendo un ingreso extra; cuenta que mientras trabaja todos los días con el auto, su esposa se dedica al negocio de carnes. Ahora él, está pensando adquirir un auto mejor implementado, con el que podrá trasportar a los pobladores de la ciudad al campo, asimismo está pensando adquirir máquinas para cortar carne, y así tener una carnicería de producción; con embutidos de toda variedad, con ello espera tener mejores ingresos para darle a su hijo una educación de nivel.Él pertenece al banco comunal “Mirando a un futuro mejor” y este es el duodécimo crédito con MFP, donde demuestra responsabilidad y seriedad, ya que es presidente de su banco comunal, donde trabaja con ahínco y mucha responsabilidad en el desarrollo constante de sus integrantes.Rolando de recibir su apoyo; comprará con el dinero solicitado varios kilos de carne de animal, ovino, vacuno y porcino. Con esto piensa abastecerá su carnicería como acostumbra.
texts.en:
40-year-old Rolando lives with his wife Guadalupe.  The couple have one son: 14-year-old Cristian.  The three of them live together in their own home which is located in the city of Tarma.  For 16 years, this hard-working man has been buying and selling sheep, cows and pigs.  He fattens them, kills them and then sells them in the butcher's shop which he acquired in the 'Mercado Modelo' market in his city through a lot of effort and commitment.  His busiest days are Thursdays and Sundays.  However, Rolando doesn't just carry out this one business, he also started providing a public transport service three years ago.  He covers the Tarma - Palcamayo route which makes him additional income.  He tells us that while he is out working with his car every day his wife looks after the butcher's shop.

Rolando plans to buy a better car and also to have a better butcher's shop with all kinds of cold meats and sausages.  He hopes that this will make him better income which he can use to provide his daughter with a good education.  Rolando belongs to the "Mirando a un futuro mejor" community bank and this is his 12th loan from MFP.  He is a responsible and serious member of his bank as he is the bank's president.  He works diligently and very responsibly to constantly help the members of the bank move forward and develop.  With your support, Rolando will use the money he has requested to buy several kilos of lamb, beef and pork.  He will use this to stock his butcher's shop.

loans.use: to stock his butcher's shop

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 47 años, convive con Yolanda, su esposa. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Hugo y Yordan. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Ricrican.La siembra de tubérculos como; papa, oyuco y oca, es su principal actividad económica; ya que desde niño creció entre la vegetación y los terrenos agrícolas, por lo que el trabajo en el campo, es lo que más le gusta. Desde que formo su propia familia, comenzó a sembrar en terrenos alquilados, pero gracias a la dedicación que brinda a sus sembríos los que cultiva, abona y cuida constantemente. Consigue vender sus cosechas, en el mercado central de su ciudad, obteniendo buenas ganancias; los que hicieron que ahora con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro, obtuviera sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Minimizando así, gastos que le permiten obtener un dinero extra, además de pensar en aumentar la cantidad que produce. Por todo lo que avanzó, Juan; desea mejorar la construcción de su casa, para darles una excelente calidad de vida a sus hijos, ya que ahora puede proyectarse a otras adquisiciones.Él pertenece al banco comunal “Mirando a un futuro mejor” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecido por el apoyo constante. Asimismo exhorta que le brinde nuevamente el pequeño préstamo, para continuar con sus objetivos.Juan de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales, los que esparcirá en sus próximos sembríos.
texts.en:
47-year-old Juan lives with his wife Yolanda.  The couple have two children: Hugo and Yordan.  They live together in their own home which is located in the village of Ricrican.  Juan grows tubers such as potatoes, oyuco and oca.  This is his main business activity.  Juan grew up amongst vegetation and farmland and working in the fields is what he enjoys most.  When he formed his own family, he started sowing his crops on land which he rented.  However, thanks to the commitment that he puts into his work sowing, fertilizing and caring for his crops, he manages to sell his harvests in the central market in town, which makes him good profits.  With a lot of hard work and saving, he was able to buy his own farmland which minimized his expenses and enabled him to make extra money and think about increasing the quantity of produce that he grows.  While Juan has made a lot of progress, he would like to make improvements to his home so that he can provide his children with an excellent quality of life.  Now he is able to plan other acquisitions.

Juan belongs to the "Mirando a un futuro mejor" community bank and this is his fifth loan from MFP.  He feels grateful for the constant support.  Juan is requesting a new small loan so that he can continue achieving his goals.  With your support, Juan will invest the money he has requested in buying natural fertilizers which he will spread over the next lot of crops he sows.

loans.use: to invest in buying natural fertilizers which he will spread over his crops

loans.name: Frencher

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulties, Frencher did not pursue his college education. He is now 20 years old and still hoping that he will earn a degree later. In the meantime, he is engaged in vegetable production to earn an income and save for his education. He endures the hardships of life and is strongly determined to be successful someday. 

He aims to increase his vegetable production to earn more income but he has insufficient capital, therefore he is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers and pesticides to sustain his vegetable production. He believes that the loan will help him to increase his production and income. 

He hopes that this year he will earn and save more money so that he will be able to continue his studies this coming school year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to sustain vegetable production

loans.name: Uranbileg

texts.en:
Uranbileg is a 43-year-old business woman who lives with her son and spouse in an outer district that does not have the basic infrastructure of  Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her spouse works at a local company, and her son attends secondary school.  

For nine years, she has been operating a business selling clothes from a small stall at Ulaanbaatar's largest outdoor market. She usually sells women’s clothes and men’s t-shirts, which she imports from Ereen, a border city between China and Mongolia.   

Uranbileg is requesting a loan for 1,500,000 MNT from Kiva lenders to purchase more clothes for the upcoming season. She is one of Transcapital’s repeat clients and is very thankful to all Kiva lenders for giving her an opportunity to make her business better.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba has been operating her home-based store for four years. She serves as the father and mother to her four grown up children. Though she's widowed, she still proves to her children that she can raise them through the income she generates from her store and hog raising business. According to her, she has been running her hog raising business for almost ten years. She is thankful because at her age (56 years old) she is still running her businesses.

Melba would like to increase her profit by increasing the volume of her stock of groceries. But, due to the high cost of basic commodities, she is in need of additional capital. She is requesting a loan amounting to P15,000 (Philippine pesos) which will allow her to buy cases of soft drinks, canned goods, instant noodles, shampoo, ingredients and assorted biscuits for her home-based store business. She believes that through her patience and hard work she could improve and save money, which will give her some security for when she gets weak.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as soft drinks, canned goods, instant noodles, shampoo, ingredients and assorted biscuits for her home-based store business.

loans.name: So

texts.en:
Mrs. So, 47, is a cheerful and hardworking woman who lives in her own home with her husband and their two children. Her children are still economically dependent on her. What she most wants is to offer her family a better quality of life. Since she was very young, Mrs. So has worked selling Khmer traditional medicines. From this business, Mrs. So earns about $3 each day. To supplement her income, her husband works as a firewood seller in front of the house. 

Mrs. So and her husband want to have a horse carriage for transporting their firewood but lack the money. Therefore, they wish to request a loan through HKL, a Kiva partner. She and her husband will use this loan to purchase a horse carriage. She hopes to be able to depend on the support of her financiers. In the future, she hopes that this loan will make her financially stable. This is Mrs. So’s first loan with Kiva, and she is very happy to know that she can count on the support of her financiers.

loans.use: to purchase a horse carriage.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar, de 34 años es un hombre trabajador, vive junto a su esposa Norma y sus dos hijos a los que cuida y educa en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Ricrican.Su principal actividad económica es “la agricultura”; ahí emprendió el largo camino del trabajo duro y sacrificado. Desde muy joven comenzó con la siembra de papa y avena; los cuales realiza una vez al año, ya que sus terrenos son “temporales”, quiere decir; que necesitan de la temporada de lluvia para que puedan producir. Pero a pesar de esa dificultad, Edgar siempre tiene buenas ganancias en su cosecha, pues dedica todo su esfuerzo en el cuidado de sus cultivos. Además de tener un ingreso extra en el cuidado de su ganado ovino, a los cuales enseba para luego vender su carne a un mayor precio. Esta actividad le proporciona el ingreso suficiente para sustentar sus gastos de alimento, vestimenta y educación de sus hijos a los cuales desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Además gusta de trabajar con su entidad de confianza ya que le brindan el apoyo económico que necesita.       
Él pertenece al banco comunal “Mirando a un futuro mejor” y este es el duodécimo préstamo con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo ofrecido durante todo este tiempo. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, asimismo asegura que esta jubiloso de pertenecer a un banco comunal  muy organizado. Edgar de recibir, su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
34-year-old Edgar is a hard-working man who lives together with his wife Norma and his two children who he cares for and educates in his own home which is located in the village of Ricrican.

Edgar's main business activity is "farming" and this is the business in which he set off on the long path of hard work.  Edgar started growing potatoes and oats when he was very young.  He grows these crops once a year as his land is "seasonal" which means that they need the rainy season in order to grow anything.  However, in spite of this difficulty, Edgar always makes good profits from his harvests as he puts a great deal of effort into looking after his crops.  He also makes additional income by caring for his sheep.  He fattens the animals and then sells their meat for a good price.  This business makes him the income he needs to feed, clothe and educate his children who he would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Edgar is a member of the "Mirando a un futuro mejor" community bank and this is his 12th loan from MFP.  He is grateful for the support that they have offered him over the years.  Edgar pledges to make his loan repayments on time.  He tells us that he is very happy to belong to a very well-organized community bank.  With your support, he will invest the money he has requested in buying natural fertilizers for the crops which he is about to sow.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is 32 years old and married. She is thankful because she has been blessed with two children.

Leny has been raising piglets for two years. She is glad because she is able to sustain the needs of her family. She would like to maintain her business and improve her farm land, but she spends all her income on her children's needs and paying her electric bills. She is requesting a loan amount of P10,000 (Philippine pesos) to buy feed supplies for the pigs she raises. She hopes that through this loan she can increase her profit so that she could buy the farm supplies needed in her rice fields. Leny believes in the saying "Time is gold" because as days and time pass by, everything changes and you can change your lifestyle to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy feed supplies for the pigs she raises

loans.name: Blas

texts.es:
Blas, de 48 años, convive con Dionisia, su esposa. Ambos tienen un hijo: Gerson, de 9 años de edad. En unión familiar, los tres viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Ricrican.Por ser una zona alta y muy productiva, comenzó con la siembra de tubérculos como: papa, oyuco, oca y mashua; su principal actividad agrícola y económica, lo que más le gusta a él, es salir todas las mañanas acompañado de una radio, donde al compás de la música cuida, riega y abona sus cultivos, según afirma “el campo es su vida”, desde niño creció aprendiendo las técnicas de cultivo y es lo único que aprendió. Por ello cada cosecha es símbolo de su perseverancia y buenos cuidados; además de poseer terrenos de cultivo en diferentes lugares de la ciudad, por lo que siembra en grandes cantidades. En el mercado mayorista de su localidad, vende no solo la cosecha de sus cultivos, también la carne del ovino que cría; pero a diferencia de sus demás pobladores, él también comercializa la lana de este animal, que es muy gruesa y protege del frío. Ahora Blas, quiere comprar un camión, con el cual piensa trasladarse con mayor facilidad, sus cultivos y los animales que comercializa.
Él pertenece al banco comunal “Mirando a un futuro mejor” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde se siente alegre; comenta, que gracias al apoyo de su banco comunal, pudo salir adelante. Razón por lo que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Blas de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en  la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales, los cuales esparcirá en su próxima cosecha.
texts.en:
48-year-old Blas lives with his wife Dionisia.  The couple have one son: 9-year-old Gerson.  The three of them live together in their own home which is located in the village of Ricicran.  As this is a mountainous and very productive area, Blas started growing tubers such as potatoes, oyuco, oca and mashua.  This is his main business activity.  What Blas most enjoys is going out every morning with his radio and watering and fertilizing his crops to the rhythm of the music.  He says "the countryside is my life".  As a boy, Blas grew up learning how to grow crops and this is all he learned.  Every harvest is a symbol of his perseverance and the attention that he has given his crops.  Blas owns farmland in different places in town which means that he grows in large quantities.  In the wholesale market in his town, Blas not only sells his harvested crops but also the meat from the sheep that he raises.  However, unlike others in his town, he also sells the wool of these animals which is very thick and provides protection from the cold.  Blas would like to buy a truck so that he can transport the crops and animals that he sells more easily.

Blas is a member of the "Mirando a un futuro mejor" community bank and this is his eighth loan from MFP.  He feels very cheerful.  He says that thanks to the support of his community bank, he has been able to get ahead in life.  For this reason, he pledges to make his loan repayments on time.  With your support, Blas will invest the money that he has requested in buying several sacks of natural fertilizer which he will spread over his crops.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of natural fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees for his dependants.

loans.name: Ceasar

texts.en:
Ceasar is a father whose principle in life is "to try and try until he succeeds." He is now 43 years old and has two school-aged children. They live happily in a village planting rice, vegetables and raising livestock. These are the main sources of their income. They aim to become successful so that they will continue sending their children to school until they earn a degree. 

Due to financial constraints, they want to improve their hog-raising business to generate additional income. Ceasar wants to ask for an additional capital of P20,000 (Philippine pesos) to buy vaccines, feeds and vitamins for his hog-raising business. He mentioned that hard work and determination are the key to make the business grow. He hopes that someday, he will raise more pigs and earn enough income to support their children's education and satisfy their needs.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, feeds and vitamins for hog-raising.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy maize for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry to expand his poultry business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase candles, sugar, beer, and food ingredients.

loans.name: Ambrosia

texts.es:
Ambrosia, de 54 años convive con Rómulo, su esposo. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos: Ivan, Ángel y Fredy. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Ricrican.
La vestimenta negra que le caracteriza, es símbolo del luto que lleva. Ya que hace poco sufrió la perdida de uno de sus hijos, pero a pesar de ello; está valerosa mujer sigue trabajando arduamente, la ganadería y la agricultura, son sus principales actividades económicas. Sus sembríos constan principalmente de papa, los que después de cada cosecha, los comercializa en el mercado mayorista de Tarma y en épocas de campaña agrícola, los lleva a la capital, donde adquiere mejores ganancias, pero como ella dice “depende mucho de precio de venta en el mercado”. Mientras que la carne que compra, lo lleva a la ciudad de San Ramón (selva central peruana), donde vende a buen precio, ya que la carne de ovino escasea y por ello la demanda. Ahora, está valiente mujer desea comprar un auto, con el cual piensa incursionar en el trasporte público y así seguir apoyando a sus hijos.Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mirando a un futuro mejor” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo de su banco comunal, que fueron personas solidarias y le brindaron apoyo en el momento más difícil de su vida. Razón por lo que es puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.Ambrosia de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
54-year-old Ambrosia lives with her husband Rómulo.  The couple have eight children but only live with three of them: Ivan, Ángel and Fredy.  They live together in their own home which is located in the village of Ricrican.

The black clothing which Ambrosia wears is a symbol of her mourning as, a short time ago, she lost one of her children.  However, in spite of that, this brave woman continues working hard.  Livestock raising and farming are her main business activities. She mainly grows potatoes which she sells in the wholesale market in Tarma after each harvest.  During the season, she takes them to the capital where she makes better profits but, as she says, "it depends a lot on the sale price in the market".  Ambrosia takes her meat to the town of San Ramón (in the central Peruvian rainforest) and sells it there for a good price.  Mutton and lamb are in short supply so there is a lot of demand.  This brave woman would like to buy a car as she plans to break into the public transport business so that she can continue supporting her children.

Ambrosia is a member of the "Mirando a un futuro mejor" community bank and this is her eighth loan from MFP.  She is grateful for the support of her community bank.  They are supportive people and they gave her support during the most difficult moment of her life.  For this reason, she makes her loan repayments on time.  With your support, Ambrosia will invest the money that she has requested in buying natural fertilizers for the crops that she is about to sow.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a resident of Kitale, Western Kenya.  He is 24 years old and married with a two-year-old child. He has been in the poultry farming business for four years, and he sells his eggs and birds to the local market. He also runs a motorcycle transport business.

James has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase more poultry to boost his business.  He says that the improved income from farming will enable him to improve his family's living standards and pay for his children's education in better schools.

He adds that a shortage of poultry feed is a challenge, but he is glad to have Juhudi's loan services.

loans.use: To purchase poultry to boost his business.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
For the past twelve years, Aba has been cooking banku and serving it with okra soup.  On her extreme left is the okra soup that she prepared for the day.  She also serves it with hot pepper sauce and fried fish at Ayensudu near Elmina. 

She is a widow taking care of three children who are currently in school. She hopes to expand her banku business and needs a loan to buy corn, peppers, tomatoes, cassava dough and firewood to make her food production easier.  Her future plan is to build a better place to host her customers.

loans.use: to buy corn, peppers, tomatoes, cassava dough and firewood to make her food production easier.

loans.name: Ntungo Tukwatanize Group

texts.en:
Resty is a 49-year-old, married woman with seven children living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She owns a bakery which she has operated for three years.  

Her major challenge has been the ever-hiking prices of bakery products which has led to reduced demand for her products since she now sells at a relatively higher price.  Resty needs the loan to buy wheat flour for making bread.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour for making bread.

loans.name: Ryan

texts.en:
Nowadays, life is difficult due to calamities and the economic crisis. But Ryan is hoping that he is going to improve his family's living status as long as he works hard. He is 22 years old and has one infant child. He raises his family in a village and generates his income through vegetable production and raising livestock. He aims to earn more income to provide for his family's needs and save for the future of his child.

At this time, he tried to plant more vegetables expecting to increase his production. But due to inadequate capital, he is asking for a loan of P10,000 (Philippine pesos) to buy fertilizers and pesticides to sustain his vegetable production. He believes that the loan will help him to increase his yields. He is hoping that he is going to reap a large volume of vegetables and earn a higher income to support his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to sustain vegetable production.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: In the picture above, behind Aba are some bags of flour. Near her right hand is some freshly baked bread, arranged to cool before bagging. Aba has been in this business for about eight years in Elmina. She is divorced and taking care of a child. The loan, when acquired, will be used to buy ingredients like sugar, yeast, salt and others to expand the volume of bread she bakes. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to buy an additional oven.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, yeast, salt and others to expand the volume of bread she bakes.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is a 34-year-old hardworking gentleman with two children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to see himself complete his studies and then start up income generating projects. He is currently a radio presenter and has been on this job for five years and his desire is to become a station man. Nicholas needs the loan to pay school fees for himself.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. She sells cloth at Ayensudu near Elmina, which she has done for seven years. Abena uses her income to assist her husband in taking care of the home by feeding the children. She will use the loan to purchase more cloth to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to save to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth to sell.

loans.name: Adiza

texts.en: Adiza sells red-red (beans that have been cooked and served with fried ripe plantain) at Elmina. She is married to a farmer and together they live with their three children.  Her business is 10 years old. She supports her husband as part of her responsibilities to educate, feed and clothe her children. Her loan will be used to buy plantain and beans. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy land.

loans.use: to buy plantain and beans.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita sells Agro chemicals at Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. The shop has been in existence for seven years. She supports her partner in providing the basic needs of the home. Her loan will be used to buy additional chemicals and other types of chemicals to be able to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to use the fresh earnings from her business to save towards the university education of her children.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy additional Agro chemicals

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is age 33 and married with two children, ages 14 and 8. She has been in poultry farming for two years in her hometown of Kitale, Western Kenya. She sells her produce of eggs at the local market. She runs a retail shop in the local market.

Monica has requested a loan of 85,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to boost her poultry business. She plans on constructing a bigger and better poultry unit for 45,000 KES and purchasing birds and feed for 40,000 KES. She says better income will enable her to venture into other businesses to broaden her sources of income and offer her better security. She wants to be the major supplier within Kitale municipality.

Monica is glad Juhudi introduced loan services with specific focus on farmers.

loans.use: to construct a poultry unit and buy more birds

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba is showing the maize she uses to make kenkey in Ayensudu near Elmina. She also sells “gboma”, as this dish is locally called by people from the Volta region of Ghana.  Gboma looks like spinach used in preparing food. 

Araba is married and has 3 children. Her partner is a farmer. Araba has been selling kenkey for 12 years. She assists her husband in taking care of the home.  Her loan will be used to buy maize in sacks to cook to sell. She hopes to use the new earnings from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: buy maize

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is a married woman with 4 children.  Her oldest child is 13 years old.

Marichu is a farmer working in Veruela, Agusan Del Sur.  She primarily grows rice crops to sell.  Marichu works hard to improve her business and her family's living conditions. She requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.  Marichu hopes that this loan will help her achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.en:
Pelagia lives in the town of Dauis, Bohol with her family. She makes rice cakes, polvoron, and tablea. Pelagia sells her products to the people in her community. She also sells dried fish.  She works hard to provide for her family’s needs.

Pelagia requested this loan to purchase more dried fish to sell and ingredients like flour and sugar. She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: purchase fish, flour and sugar

loans.name: Quirina Gengque

texts.en:
Quirina Genggue is a 40-year-old married woman with 4 children.  Her oldest child is 12 years old.

Quirina has been in the business of raising hogs for 5 years. She earns about 7,500 PHP per month from it. Quirina also makes banana cues and rice cakes that she sells to the people in her community.

Quirina plans to use her loan to purchase pig feed, flour and bananas. She hopes to have a progressive business.

loans.use: purchase pig feed, flour and bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a motor engine

loans.name: Ediltrudes

texts.en:
Ediltrudes is 44 years old and single. She is a coconut shell dealer. She grows coconut trees on her land and also buys from other farmers. Ediltrudes has had her business for more than 20 years now. She earns about 8000 PHP per month. Ediltrudes is happy that she has regular customers now.

Ediltrudes is requesting a loan to purchase more fertilizers and coconut shells to sell. She hopes to grow her business in the future.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and coconut shells

loans.name: Asibe

texts.en: Asibe sells cooked rice and serves it with tomato sauce, macaroni, fried fish and hot pepper sauce (shito) at Elmina.  She has done this for 9 years. Asibe is a single parent taking care of 2 children.  She uses her earnings to pay school fees and other household expenses.   Asibe will use this loan to purchase rice, tomatoes, cooking oil and other ingredients. She anticipates reinvesting the new profit.

loans.use: purchase rice, tomatoes, cooking oil and other ingredients

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia is 68 years old and married. She has 3 children.

Cornelia is in the business of raising hogs. She fattens the pigs and sells them at the market. Cornelia also makes barbecue that she sells to the people in her community. She has a stall where she sells her barbecue and softdrinks.

Cornelia has requested a loan to purchase pig feed, softdrinks and pork and chicken meat. She hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: purchase pig feed, softdrinks and pork and chicken meat

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Due to the economic crisis, life has become more difficult and most of the poor families can not afford to finance the education of their children. But Edward, who belongs to a poor family, has the desire to give his children the education they need and a better life.  Edward is now 53 years old and has two adult children. Through patience and hard work, his eldest son has earned a degree while his youngest is still in college.

Edward wants to improve his hog-raising business to earn income and support the education of his daughter.  He wants to ask for an additional capital of P10,000 to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for his hog-raising business. He believes that with the help of this loan, he is going to raise more pigs and earn more income.   He hopes that his patience and sacrifices will bear good fruit someday and his dream will come true.

loans.use: buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for his pigs

loans.name: Ponciana

texts.en:
Ponciana earns a living through hog raising and “tuba” (coconut wine) vending. She has a backyard piggery where she fattens pigs to sell at the market. Ponciana sells her “tuba” to retail stores in her town.

Ponciana requested this loan to purchase piglets, feed and containers for tuba. She hopes to have a better income and be able to improve her house.

loans.use: purchase piglets, feed and wine containers

loans.name: Remedio

texts.en: Remedio is 46 years old and married. He has a sari-sari store located in Albur, Bohol. He sells items like school supplies, eggs and canned goods. Aside from his store, Remedio also owns and manages a poultry business. Remedio works hard to provide for his family. He requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as school supplies and canned goods.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as school supplies and canned goods

loans.name: Ayishatu

texts.en: Ayishatu is married and has five children. She bakes small chops like chips, rock bans, spring rolls and others for sale in Elmina. She has been in this business for seven years. As part of her wifely duties, she feeds the children. She will use this loan to purchase flour, sugar and other ingredients for baking. She plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and other ingredients for baked goods to sell.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a 54-year-old married woman. She has a sari-sari store business. She sells items like noodles, diapers, and soap. Elma struggles but through her store, she is able to provide for her family’s basic needs.

Elma requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as noodles, canned goods, and soft drinks. She hopes to start another business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as noodles, canned goods, and soft drinks

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is 30 years old, married, with 3 children aged 1 through 13. They live in a rented house with 3 people and her family goal is to build a family house. She has a beauty salon business and has been operating this business for 4 years. She started working in someone else's salon then later started her own with savings from her wages. Her major challenge is the current inflation in the country which has led to high costs of operation. Her dream is to set up a modern salon. Rosemary needs a loan to buy cosmetics and hair braids for the salon.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and hair braids

loans.name: Ayishatu

texts.en: Ayishatu sells food items like salted fish, canned tomatoes and powdered pepper at Ayensudu near Elmina.  She has done this for 6 years. Ayishatu   is married. Her husband is a farmer and together they live with six dependents. She uses her income to see to the well-being of her home. She will use this loan to purchase salted fish, tomatoes, salt and other food items to sell. With the new profits from her extended business, Ayishatu plans to build a shop.

loans.use: purchase salted fish, tomatoes, salt and other food items to sell

loans.name: Urcisina

texts.en:
Urcisina is 62 years old.  She is from the town of Loon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari store business, selling items such as vinegar and canned goods. She also makes banana chips that she sells to the people in her community.

Urcisina is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as soap, shampoo, noodles and canned goods. She will also buy more bananas to make chips. Urcisina hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: buy soap, shampoo, noodles and canned goods

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is divorced and has 5 children. She sells fruits such as pineapple, water melon and others at Elmina, which she has done for 10 years. The income she makes from the sale of the fruits is used to take care of her children. Efua will use the loan to procure more fruits to sell. With the new profits from her extended business, Efua plans to plough back into her business.

loans.use: buy fruits

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a farmer. Ekua is a retailer of pineapple and other fruits at Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast.  She has done this for 8 years. Ekua uses her revenue to help her husband to educate, feed and clothe their children. Ekua will use the loan to acquire more fruits and vegetables for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to save towards the building of a fruit stand.

loans.use: buy fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan is 21 years old and has 2 children. She lives in the town of Dauis, Bohol, with her family.  Joan is in the business of pig breeding. She sells piglets to the people in her community. Joan works hard to save for her children’s future. She plans to use her loan to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies. Joan hopes to expand her piggery in the future.

loans.use: buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie is 35 years old and is a married woman with 2 children. She makes baskets for a living. She does not have a basket shop yet but hopes to have one in the future. Emelie has regular customers who buy her baskets.

Emelie requested this loan to buy materials to make baskets. Emelie wants to earn better so she can sustain her children’s education.

loans.use: buy materials to make baskets

loans.name: Romula

texts.en:
Romula is 54 years old and married. She has a carenderia (eatery) located in Cortez, Bohol. She cooks viands that she sells to the people in her community. Romula works hard to support her family.

Romula is requesting a loan to buy raw ingredients like meat, vegetables, oil and vinegar. Romula hopes to expand her eatery in the future.

loans.use: buy meat, vegetables, oil and vinegar

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is married and has 6 children. She makes fante kenkey to sell at Ayensudu, which she has done for 9 years. Her husband is a farmer. Ekua uses her income to assist her husband to take care of the home.  She will use this loan to purchase maize in sacks to make kenkey for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to reinvest for further growth. 

To prepare her kenkey, she buys maize from the market and soaks it in water to soften the maize for three days. On the third day, she washes the maize and sends it to the mill to be milled. She then makes a mixture of dough out of the milled wet corn and leaves it for a day.  She then divides the risen dough into two. She mixes one with water to get it into a porridge-like consistency form and cooks it until it is firm, but not fully cooked. She later mixes the rest of the uncooked dough with the half-cooked dough. She moulds the dough into balls and wraps them in corn husk. She then cooks them again till they become soft enough to eat.  Kenkey can be eaten with various kinds of sauces such as pepper sauce. It is often served with meat or fish such as fried or roasted fish, roasted chicken, and roasted turkey.

loans.use: purchase maize to make kenkey

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar is 58 years old and married. He runs a carenderia (eatery) located in Tagbilaran City, Bohol. He cooks viands everyday to sell to the people in his community. Cesar wakes up at 5 in the morning to start cooking since he has customers who come to eat breakfast.

Cesar requested this loan to buy raw ingredients such as pork, chicken, vegetables and spices. Cesar hopes to renovate his eatery in the future.

loans.use: buy pork, chicken, vegetables and spices

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 26 years old and single. She has a fish selling business in Panglao, Bohol. Josephine buys directly from fishermen in her town. She said she can get a lower price if she comes early and be the first one to buy fish from the fishermen. Josephine rents a stall in her town’s market to sell fish.

Josephine has requested this loan to buy more fish and containers. She hopes for her business to grow in the future.

loans.use: buy fish and containers

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen is 30 years old, married, with 2 children aged 5 and 7, living in her own house in Hioma, Uganda. She is married to a teacher and their dream is to set up a sustainable income-generating activity for the family. She has a produce business and has been operating it for 7 years. Her major challenge is the seasonal nature of the products and her dream is to have a food store. Doreen needs the loan facility to buy rice, groundnuts, and maize for sale.

loans.use: to buy rice, groundnuts, and maize for sale.

loans.name: Ekua Agnes

texts.en: Ekua is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a farmer. Ekua sells groundnuts and maize that have been cooked together and wrapped in a corn husk. To make this kind of dish, the corn is dehusked to get it white, the groundnuts are boiled, and later put together, tied, and boiled in the corn husk. She has been in this trade for 11 year. She is a vendor of this food. The income she makes from her sales is added to that of her husband to take care of the home. Ekua Agnes will use the loan to purchase more groundnuts and maize. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to save to buy land.

loans.use: to purchase more groundnuts and maize.

loans.name: Chung

texts.en: Chung was born in 1952. She lives in Xom Huong village, Co Loa commune with her husband and two children. She and her husband are farmers. They not only grow rice and vegetables, but they also raise pigs. Sometimes, Mrs Chung has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2004 and always repays punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy food for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is a 38-year-old married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She has a hog-raising business. Myrna built a backyard piggery where she raises pigs to sell at the market. Myrna works hard to help provide for her family. She requested a loan to purchase piglets, feed and vitamins. Myrna hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is a single parent taking care of three children. She makes millet porridge to sell. She serves it with fried doughnuts. Her business is about three years old. Esi will use the loan to purchase additional millet, sugar and others to cook to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to reinvest back into the business. 

To prepare her porridge, she first gets her millet, removes unwanted particles from it, and washes it.  She adds local spices such as ginger and pepper to taste.  She sends the millet to the mill to be milled into powder.  After returning from the mill, she adds water to the resulting flour to make dough. She leaves it for a couple of hours before using the dough to make porridge. She heats water to the boiling point and mixes the dough into the water to get a porridge-like consistency. She gradually pours the dough into the heated water, stirring continuously to prevent it from forming lumps. The porridge only has to cook for a couple of minutes and then it is ready to be served. Millet porridge goes with bread of any kind and fried doughnuts.

loans.use: to purchase additional millet, sugar and other items to cook to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is divorced and has 6 children. She is a peddler in cloths at Ayensudu near Elmina, which she has done for 15 years. Agnes uses her income to feed, clothe and educate her children. She wants to increase her sales and so needs a loan to purchase more cloths to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to save towards the university education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more cloths to sell.

loans.name: Jifferson

texts.en:
Jifferson is 27 years old and still single. He did not pursue his secondary education due to financial burden. Despite this, he engages in vegetable production to help his parents in gaining income for their basic necessities, and finance the education of his younger brothers and sisters. He has been in this business for almost 9 years now. 

At his age, he is planning to get married, but thought that he needs to earn and save more money so that he is able to support his family when they are going to settle down. At this time, he planned to plant more vegetables but due to inadequate capital, he wants to ask a loan of P10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to sustain his vegetable production. He believes that this loan will help him work out his plan. 

He hopes that in the future, he will raise his own family and give them a better life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for vegetable production

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 50 years old and married. She has a sari-sari store business located in Panglao, Bohol. She sells various items like canned goods, vinegar, and coffee. Aside from her store, Delia also cooks viands that she sells to the people in her community.

Delia has requested this loan to buy more items to sell and more raw ingredients like meat and vegetables. Delia hopes for her ventures to prosper.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell and more raw ingredients like meat and vegetables

loans.name: Muniratu

texts.en: Muniratu is married and has four children. She cooks banku and rice balls at Elmina, which she has done for two years. Her husband is a security man. She uses the revenue she generates from her business to assist her husband to take care of the home. Muniratu will use the loan to procure bags of maize and rice to cook to sell. Muniratu plans to plow back the new profits from her stretched business for further growth.

loans.use: to procure bags of maize and rice

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en: Abiba is married and has three children. She sells rice, beans and plastic bowls at Ayensudu near Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. She has been doing this for three years. Her husband is a driver. Abiba uses her income to support her spouse to educate, feed and clothe her children. Abiba will use the loan to obtain more plastic bowls to resell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abiba plans to build a shop.

loans.use: to obtain more plastic bowls to resell.

loans.name: Toan

texts.en: Toan was born in 1952. She lives in Xom Huong village, Co Loa commune. Her husband has died. She is working hard. She has a store. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2007 and always repays her loans punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 7,630,000 VND to buy grocery(cakes, candy, salt, sugar, soap,ete) to resell.

loans.use: to buy grocery(cakes, candy, salt, sugar, soap,ete) to resell.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 24 years old and single. She lives in the town of Panglao, Bohol. Joy raises pigs to earn a living. She has a small backyard piggery. Joy also sells fish to the people in her community. Joy buys directly from fishermen in her town.

Joy has requested this loan to purchase piglets, feed and vitamins. She hopes to save for her future family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is 54 years old and a widow. She earns a living by selling barbecue to the people in her community. Lucresia makes chicken and pork barbecue. She also sells hotdogs, which are in demand by the children in her community.

Lucresia has requested this loan to buy pork and chicken meat, hotdogs and sticks. She hopes to open her own eatery in the future.

loans.use: to buy pork and chicken meat, hotdogs and sticks

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is 52 years old and married. She raises pigs for a living. She has a backyard piggery where she feeds her pigs to sell at the market. Andresa also makes rice cakes and other delicacies that she sells to the people in her community.

Andresa has requested this loan to buy more piglets, feed and vitamins. She hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more piglets, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a 48-year-old married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She has a fishing business. Her husband is a fisherman and is the one who mainly operates their fishing boat. Elvira helps by selling his catch at the market. Elvira does her best to improve their business and support her family.

Elvira requested a loan to buy fishing nets, hooks and gear. This loan will help Elvira and her husband have more fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, hooks and gear

loans.name: Senen

texts.en:
Senen is 42 years old and runs an eatery in Panglao, Bohol. She sells food that she cooks herself. She also makes barbecue. Senen also sells soft drinks at her eatery. She said she is happy that she has regular customers now, compared to when she first started.

Senen has requested this loan to buy ingredients such as pork and chicken meat, vegetables, spices and soft drinks. Senen hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as pork and chicken meat, vegetables, spices and soft drinks

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora runs a sari-sari store business and sells snack foods, cooking oil and spices. Flora is married and blessed with seven children. Flora’s husband is a farmer, planting rice and vegetables. Flora only finished her elementary level of education even though she wanted to enter college, because her parents had no capacity to send her to school. This reason pushes her to work hard to be able to send her children to school until college. She wants her children to finish their education because she doesn't want them to be like her. She wants them to have a better future someday. Flora has two children in college and prays that they will finish their studies. 

Flora wishes to expand her business and earn a higher income to further sustain her children's needs in school. She wants to borrow a loan for PHP 20,000 to buy additional goods to sell in their village like drinks, bread, eggs and coffee.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in their village like drinks, bread, eggs and coffee.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 64 years old and a widow. She lives in Panglao, Bohol. Juana sells fish for a living. She buys from fishermen in her town. Juana goes around her neighborhood to sell her fish. She also makes dried fish to sell.

Juana has requested this loan to buy more fish and containers. She hopes for this loan to help grow her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and containers

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Even though my parents have no capacity to send me to school, I strive just to finish my college education, Consolacion says. She worked as a secretary and got married when she was 25 years old. After marriage, Consolacion resigned her work. She and her husband are blessed with two children. Her husband is a farmer working in the Philippines.

In times of financial crisis, Consolacion goes abroad just to sustain her family needs. She worked as a domestic helper for 10 years. When she had enough earnings, she came back to the Philippines and make a decision to put up a sari-sari store business in which she sells snack foods, sugar, coffee, vinegar and cooking oil.
 
Consolacion says even though there are struggles in her life, she is still happy because she successfully sent her children to college and holds a degree. She is also happy because she sees that her children are now professionals.

Nowadays, sometimes Consolacion encounters problem because her sari-sari store is her only source of income for their daily needs. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase beans, diapers, drinks and bread to sell in their village. She hopes for the growth of the business and a higher income.

loans.use: to purchase beans, diapers, drinks and bread to sell in their village.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with three children. The oldest child is 15 years old.

Marilyn is engaged in farming. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Marilyn said farming is challenging, especially since she cannot control the weather. Marilyn works hard to help provide for her family.

Marilyn has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to help uplift her family's living conditions. She also desires to see her children finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves is a 52-year-old woman who lives in the town of Veruela, Agusan Del Sur. She earns a living through farming. Nieves primarily grows rice crops to sell. She has had a farming business for 20 years now.

Nieves requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. Nieves hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is a married woman with three children aged 16, 12 and 10. They live in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur.

Anabelle is a farmer. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Anabelle does her best to be a good mother and wife. She wants to have a happy and healthy family.

Anabelle is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and gasoline for the tractor. She hopes for this loan to help increase her harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and gasoline for the tractor

loans.name: Dulamhand

texts.en: Dulamhand is 34 years old and lives with her two daughters and father in a one-room apartment in Songinohairhan district, Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her two daughters are both high school students. Dulamhand operates picture trading business. She started her business in 2002. She paints by her self and sells her paintings at Local market. Her business is going well as she has collected nine years of working experience. She is planning to open her exhibition in the near future. She is a diligent and honest woman who says, "I want to expand my business and have constant income sources." She is requesting 1,500,000 MNT loan to remodel her apartment.

loans.use: To remodel her apartment

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is a 48-year-old married man with six children. His oldest child is 16 years old. 

Mario is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. He has been growing and selling rice for nine years now. Mario is able to provide for his family through his income. Although he finds it quite difficult to sustain his children's education, he still works hard to provide his children a proper education.

Mario has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and gasoline for the tractor. He hopes to save for his children's education. He also wants to be a successful farmer in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and gasoline for the tractor

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is 43 years old and is a married man with four children. The oldest child is 25 years old.

Ricardo is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. Ricardo also raises pigs to sell. He also put up a sari-sari store business to help with their daily needs. Ricardo's wife manages the store.

Ricardo has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, pig feed and more items to sell at his store. He hopes for his ventures to prosper in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pig feed and items to sell at his store

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a 41-year-old married woman with four children. The oldest child is 23 years old.

Luzviminda is a farmer working in Trento, Agusan Del Sur. She grows rice, corn and pineapples on her land. Luzviminda hopes to continue earning from her farm so she can sustain her children's education.

Luzviminda has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a 58-year-old married woman with four children. The oldest child is 37 years old.

Violeta is a farmer working in Trento, Agusan Del Sur. She grows rice crops and vegetables on her land. Violeta earns about 10,000 PHP per month from farming. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs. She hopes to improve her family's living conditions through her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 46-year-old married woman with two children aged 15 and 16. She is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. Esther grows rice and corn crops on her land. Esther wants to increase her earnings so she can sustain her family, especially her children's education.

Esther is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She hopes to sustain her children's college education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Vegelyn

texts.en:
Vegelyn is a 40 year old married woman with 3 children aged 15, 14 and 12. She earns a living growing and selling rice and corn. Vegelyn works hard to send her children to school. It is her dream to see them succeed in the future.

Vegelyn has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. This loan will help Vegelyn achieve her goals.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rogen

texts.en:
Rogen is 37 years old and married. He has 2 children aged 14 and 3.

Rogen is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. He grows rice crops to sell. Rogen earns about 4800 PHP per month doing this farming. He plans to use his loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Rogen hopes to have a bigger farm.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 43 years old and is a married woman with 4 children. The oldest child is 24 years old.

Divina earns a living through farming. She grows rice crops to sell at the market. She earns about 6,000 PHP per month doing this farming.  Divina has requested a loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds. Divina hopes that, in the future, she will have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Sigara Group

texts.en:
Rehemer, who is in her mid-30s, is married with four children who are still going to school. She has had a grocery business since 2004.  She works from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her stock, pay school fees, household expenses and also renovated her house. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to further increase the grocery inventory. Her dream is to one day be able to own a car so that she can deliver her grocery items easily, and also so she and her children can be mobile.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Sigara", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase grocery inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 57 years old and is a married woman with 3 children. Her husband works as a farmer.

Carmelita has had a sari-sari (convenience) store business for 2 years. She sells items like vinegar, canned goods and noodles. Carmelita works hard to help provide for her family's needs. She requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, shampoo and soap. Carmelita hopes for this loan to help grow her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, shampoo and soap

loans.name: Jenilyn

texts.en:
Jenilyn is 33 years old and married. She has 2 children ages 7 and 6. Jenilyn's husband is a farmer.

Jenilyn has had a sari-sari (convenience) store business for 3 years. She sells canned goods, sugar, coffee and other various products. Jenilyn also helps her husband grow rice on their farm. She plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, coffee, sugar and other items.

In the future, Jenilyn hopes to have a bigger store.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, coffee, sugar and other items

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is proud that she is a full-blooded Igorot, an ethnic group in the mountains of northern Luzon. Cynthia did not finish college because of financial shortage. She is 41 years old, married and has five children.

Cynthia is engaged in a business direct-selling lipstick, lotion, shampoo and fragrances. She wanted to help her husband in sustaining their family needs and to give a better future to their children. Cynthia doesn’t want her children to experience suffering, so that’s why she is doing her best for them.

Cynthia is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy shoes, sandals, shirts, face powder and roll-on to sell to her customers around their village. Her goal is to have all of her five children finish their college and become professionals someday.

loans.use: to buy shoes, sandals, shirts, face powder and roll-on to sell

loans.name: Tamalinda Group

texts.en:
Mwanahamis is in her early 30s and is married with two children who are still in school. Since 2007, she has operated a food vendor business and she works from six in the morning through four in the afternoon to make a fair monthly profit. This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  Mwanahamis used her previous loans to increase her food stock and provide for household expenses. She has successfully repaid her previous loans.

Mwanahamis is requesting a loan to increase the stock of ingredients for her business. She will share her loan with her group “Tamalinda,” which has 17 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying their loans. In the future, Mwanahamis dreams of buying land and building her own house.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is 38 years old and married to a farmer. She is blessed with four children whom she is sending to school. Liberty manages a business raising hogs and her husband also works as a mechanic and repairs damaged cars. Liberty and her husband help each other to attain their goal of providing a good quality of life for their children. She and her husband believe that one way of doing this is to provide for their needs and send them to school. Liberty believes that education is the key to success. 

Liberty is requesting a 10,000 PHP a loan to buy feed for her pigs. She looks forward to the growth of her business.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter de 26 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería  y artesanía.

Walter desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas), su corral que se encuentra a unos minutos de su casa, los cuales son amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y  pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento  ideal, para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos personales.   También cuenta con tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón y una vez que cosecha lo comercializa teniendo otro para su casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar de alimento para engordar a sus animales y fertilizante para mejorar sus tierras, al igual que su producto y así venderlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes, con esos ingresos podrá pagar su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Walter es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo que lo único que quiere es poder brindarle algunas comodidades a su familia y lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
26-year-old Walter lives with his wife and children in his own home which doesn't have basic services.  The house is located in the rural part of Tambogrande district, in Piura department.  This area is noted for its livestock raising, farming and handicrafts.

Walter has been raising and selling sheep for several years.  His pen is located a few minutes from his home and it is spacious.  He feeds his animals balanced feed and pasture so that they reach an ideal level of growth and he is able to sell them in the different markets in his area, making very good profits with which to cover his personal expenses.  He also owns farmland where he grows lemons.  He harvests and sells the lemons which makes him another income for his household.

Walter has requested a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He will use this money to buy feed with which to fatten his animals and fertilizers with which to improve his land and his crops.  This will enable him to sell them to his customers at a better price.  He will use the income that he makes to repay his loan and improve his quality of life.  Walter is very committed to his work.  The only thing he wants is to be able to provide his family with some comforts and achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy feed for his animals and fertilizers to improve his land

loans.name: Segundo Gilberto

texts.es:
Segundo de 48 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia,la cual cuenta sólo con servicio de luz, ubicada en la provincia de Morropón que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

La actividad que desarrolla Martín es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra maíz y legumbres, una vez que realiza su cosecha su producto los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de Piura y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de su casa. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto, con la finalidad de ofertarlo a un mejor precio a los comerciantes y así mejorar económicamente.  Martín es un padre de familia que se preocupa por que su familia mejore y tenga algunas comodidades.
texts.en:
48-year-old Segundo lives with his family in his own home which only has electricity.  The house is located in Morropón province, in Piura department.  This area is noted for its farming, livestock raising and handicrafts.

Segundo's business is farming.  He owns his own farmland where he grows corn and vegetables.  When he harvests his crops, he sells them in the different markets in Piura which enables him to make income with which to cover his household expenses.

Segundo has requested a loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy fertilizers so that he can improve his land and his crops.  This will enable him to sell at a better price and thereby improve his financial situation.  Segundo is a father who wants to improve his family's situation and provide them with some comforts.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to improve his land and crops

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel de 66 años de edad, vive con su esposa en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Pacora que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

Angel desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, su corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados, los alimenta con comida balanceada para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos de casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles  para la compra de más animales como pavos y su respectivo alimento, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Angel es una persona que con esfuerzo y empeño a sabido salir adelante y brindarle algunas comodidades a su esposa.
texts.en:
66-year-old Angel lives with his wife in his own home which has water and electricity.  The house is located in the rural district of Pacora, in Lambayeque department.  The people in this area work in farming and livestock raising.

Angel has been raising and selling farmyard animals for some yeras.  His pens are located behind his home and they are suitable for the animals.  He feeds his animals balanced feed so that they reach an optimal level of development.  This means he is able to sell them in the different markets in his area and make good profits with which to cover his household expenses.

Angel has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more animals such as turkeys and feed.  He will use the profits that he makes from selling his animals to repay his loan and enjoy a better quality of life.  Angel is a person who, through hard work and determination, has known how to get ahead in life and provide his wife with some comforts in life.

loans.use: to buy more farmyard animals and their respective feed

loans.name: Carmen Jessenia

texts.es:
Carmen de 28 años de edad, es soltera, vive en su casa propia,  no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Catacaos que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Toda esta zona sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería, artesanía y turismo.

Carmen se dedica a la elaboración, venta de chicha de jora (es una bebida rica elaborada a base de maíz y  muy consumida en el norte del Perú), actividad que realiza desde hace varios años, ya que es una costumbre que ha pasado de generación en generación. Últimamente se ha incrementado las ventas de la chicha de jora en la zona donde vive, lo que le ha favorecido para poder incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su nivel de vida.  

Teniendo la oportunidad de mejorar su negocio Carmen a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar mesas, sillas, insumos para la chicha de jora y realizar algunos arreglos en su negocio, con la finalidad de obtener mayores ganancias y así sus clientes aumenten, para solventar el crédito otorgado y mejorar economicamente.
texts.en:
28-year-old Carmen is single and lives in her own home which doesn't have basic services.  Her house is located in the rural part of Catacaos district, in Piura department.  Throughout this area, local people work in farming, livestock raising, handicrafts and tourism.

Carmen makes and sells 'chicha de jora' (a delicious drink made from corn which is drunk a lot in the north of Peru).  She has been in this business for several years.  It is a custom which has been handed down from generation to generation.  Recently, sales of 'chicha de jora' have increased in Carmen's area which has been good news for her.  She has been able to increase her income and improve her standard of living.

As she has the opportunity to improve her business, Carmen has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy tables, chairs and supplies for making 'chicha de jora'.  She will also make some repairs.  Her goal is to make more profits and increase her number of customers.  This will enable her to repay her loan and improve her financial situation.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and supplies for making 'chicha de jora', and to make some repairs

loans.name: Katherine Del Milagro

texts.es:
Katherine de 23 años, vive con su esposo e hijo en la casa de su madre, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.    Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Katherine se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 4 años para toda la familia, negocio que a colocado en su domicilio, su mercadería lo ofrece a sus clientes, también trae a pedido, tratando de tener mayor demanda de clientes y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Al observar que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1200 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería y abastecer su tienda con productos innovadores, con la finalidad que su clientela siga aumentando para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Katherine es un madre muy preocupada y junto con su esposo trata que todos los días no le falte nada a su hijo.
texts.en:
