La Señora Martha es socia del banco comunal Luz y Vida, vive por la comunidad de Aguacate en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, es la tercera ciudad  más importante del país, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres, su variada gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propio y extraños.

Doña Martha tiene 37 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 16, 10, 9 y 1 año de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en la escuela.  Su esposo es mecánico industrial y labora en su propio taller donde arreglan toda clase de máquinas. La casa en que viven es de su propiedad.

La Señora Martha se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos en especial de su ultima hija, también labora en el taller de su esposo ayudándole en lo que necesita, trabaja allí de lunes a sábados y tienen este negocio hace 7 años.
 
En el banco comunal es socia fundadora y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  hierro, sueldas, pinturas, etc. para el taller de su esposo.
 
Su meta es que crezca el negocio familiar..
texts.en:
Señora Martha is a member of the communal bank "Luz y Vida", ("Light and Life").  She lives in the community of Aguacate in the city of Cuenca.  This city has a cool climate; it's the third most important city in the country, and its people keep up the culture and traditions of their forefathers.  Its varied gastronomy captivates the palate of both locals and visitors.

Doña Martha is 37 years old.  She is married, and has 4 children from her marriage, aged 16, 10, 9 and one year old.  Her oldest son attends high school, and her two younger children are in primary school.  Her husband is an industrial mechanic, and he works in his own workshop where he fixes all types of machines.  The house where they live is their own property.

Señora Martha looks after her children, especially her youngest daughter.  She also works in her husband's workshop, helping him as needed.  She works there from Monday through Saturday, and they have had this business for seven years.

She is a founding member of the communal bank, and she will invest this new loan in the purchase of iron, solder, paint, etc. for her husband's workshop.

Her dream is for the family business to grow.

loans.use: to buy iron, solder, paint, etc.

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es: La señora Claudia Maria, ella tiene 37 años, es una mujer casada y tiene 2 hijos bajo su cargo. Hace más 12 años que se dedica a la venta de ropa, ubicada en su casa y de manera ambulante. Ella dio inicio a este negocio ante la necesidad que sufría de ingresos para la manutención de su familia en general. Por lo que con todo el esfuerzo logro obtener capital propio. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, vestidos entre otros. Su deseo es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en: 37-year-old Claudia Maria is a married woman and has two children in her care.  She has been selling clothes from home and as an itinerant street vendor for more than 12 years.  She started her business as she needed to make income with which to support her family.  With a lot of effort, she managed to obtain her own capital.  This loan will be invested in buying pants, shirts, skirts, suits and dresses, etc.  Claudia's dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy pants, skirts, suits, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Jose Joaquin

texts.es:
José, vive junto a su madre, está soltero y se dedica a la venta y reparación de bicicletas, lleva muchos años trabajando en el negocio, y ha ido mejorando con el tiempo, él ya tiene  experiencia en el manejo de este negocio trabaja de lunes a sábado de 7:00am a 5:00pm.
Por segunda ocasión solicita un préstamo para la compra de lotes de bicicletas nuevas, este apoyo con los prestamos le ha dado mejoras al negocio e incrementado su ganancia.
La proyección es seguir en desarrollo con el negocio, ofrecer bicicletas de calidad y con estilos nuevos, trabajar de la mano de préstamos para poder alcanzar el desarrollo deseado.
texts.en:
José is single and lives together with his mother.  He sells and repairs bicycles.  He has been in this business for many years and has improved the business over time.  He has experience in running his business and works from Monday to Saturday, from 7.00am to 5.00pm.

José is requesting his second loan to buy some new bicycles.  The support of these loans has improved his business and increased his profits.

José's plan is to continue developing his business, selling good-quality bicycles in new styles.  He will work with loans in order to be able to reach the level of development he desires.

loans.use: to buy new bicycles for his business

loans.name: María Cruz

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Luz y Vida, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia tiene hermosos paisajes, su gente es muy amable, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.
 
La Señora. María tiene 45 años, está separada de su marido pero de esta unión tiene 8 hijos, dos son casados e independientes, dos trabajan para sus gastos, dos estudian en el colegio y su ultimo hijo está en una escuelita de la ciudad. La casa en la que vive es propia y es fruto de su trabajo y sacrificio.

Doña María se dedica al cuidado de su familia y está encargada de cuidar a 4 nietos, como la mayor parte del tiempo pasa en casa también se dedica al a cría y venta  de animales como: cerdos, pavos, gansos, cuyes y gallinas a los que los vende en su propia comunidad.

Nuestra socia se encuentra 4 años en el banco comunal y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y en su alimento.
 
Su meta es tener un negocio como una picantería o un negocio de venta de comida rápida.
texts.en:
María is a member of the 'Luz y Vida' community bank.  She lives on the outskirts of El Valle parish.  This parish has beautiful landscape.  The locals are very kind and they maintain their parents' culture and traditions.

María is 45 years old and separated from her husband.  She has eight children from her marriage.  Two of her children are married and living independently, two are working to cover their expenses, two are in high school and her youngest son attends elementary school in the town.  María owns the home in which she lives.  It is the fruit of her work and sacrifice.

María looks after her family and also cares for four grandchildren.  As she spends most of her time at home, she also raises and sells animals such as pigs, turkeys, geese, guinea pigs and hens which she sells in her community.

María has been a member of her community bank for four years and she will invest her new loan in buying pigs and pig feed.

María's goal is to own a business such as a small restaurant or a fast food business.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Marilenis Alcira

texts.es:
Marlenis, vive con su hija de dos años de edad, se dedica a la venta de Hot dog, lleva un año en el negocio, trabaja de lunes a domingo de 8:00am a 6:00pm.
Ella necesita por el momento un préstamo para la compra de carne, mortadela, jamón, aderezos y pan, estos productos los necesita para aumentar la producción de su negocio y poder mejorar la atención a los clientes.
Su objetivo es buscar alternativas para mantener el negocio, ya que depende de él para poder ayudar a su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Marlenis lives with her 2 year old daughter. She sells hot dogs. She has had the business for a year and works Monday through Sunday, 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.

Currently, she needs a loan to buy meat, mortadella, ham, seasonings and bread. She needs these products to increase her production and to improve customer service.

She aims to find ways to keep the business going as she depends on it to take care of her small daughter

loans.use: to buy meat, mortadella, ham, seasonings and bread for the business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosario es socia del banco comunal Luz y Vida, vive por el sector de Monay en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres, su variada gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propio y extraños.

Doña Rosario tiene 44 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 22, 17 y 5 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en una universidad de la ciudad, su segundo hijo estudia en el colegio y su último hijo está en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

La Señora Rosario se dedica al cuidado de su familia y a la cría y venta de pollos.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 2 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la comprar de materiales de construcción para hacer algunos arreglos de su vivienda.
 
Su meta es darles a sus hijos los mejores estudios para que salgan adelante
texts.en:
Señora Rosario is a member of the communal bank "Luz y Vida", (Light and Life").  She lives in the Monay sector of the city of Cuenca.  This city has a cool climate, and it is the third most important city in the country.  It's people keep up the culture and traditions of their forefathers, and its varied gastronomy cultivates the palate of locals and visitors alike.

Doña Rosario is 44 years old.  She is married, and has 3 children from her marriage aged 22, 17, and 5 years old. Her eldest daughter is studying at a university in the city.  Her second child, a son, attends high school, and her youngest son is in a primary school in the city.  Her husband is a mechanic by profession, and the house where they live is their own property.

Señora Rosario takes care of the family, and raises and sells chickens.

She has been a member of the communal bank for two years, and her new loan is to invest in the purchase of construction materials to make some repairs to her home.

Her goal is to provide her children with the best education so that they can move ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 33 years old and married with two school-aged children. She lives in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Rosemarie is a farmer who grows palay (unmilled rice) to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years on cloudy or even rainy days when necessary. Rosemarie earns 10,000 PHP a month which includes all permanent and impermanent sources. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2009 and has taken out five previous loans from the cooperative.

Rosemarie is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan from GDMPC to purchase fertilizer to facilitate crop growth. In the future, she hopes to have a good harvest and plans to apply appropriate pest-and-insect-fighters to avoid plant devastation. She furthermore aims to expand her business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: G.s. Ana Virgen Noble Group

texts.es: La señora Manuela tiene  su negocio que es elaboración de tortillas. Ella aduce que a veces ventas son malas caen y tiene que cambiar a otras alternativas de negocio para mover siempre el dinero. Desea hacer más grande el negocio tanto con préstamos como con las utilidades generadas por el mismo negocio. La señora Yesenia del Socorro tiene su negocio que consiste en la venta de cosméticos y ahora también se está introduciendo a la venta de ropa. Ella solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos,  como lápiz labial, cremas, tratamientos, shampoo, perfumes entre otros. Aduce que su negocio antes era más pequeño y gracias a los préstamos otorgados por Kiva y Fundación León 2000 ha ido creciendo. Ella además trabaja de domestica y también su esposo trabaja. Desea continuar invirtiéndole a su negocio para seguir teniendo las ganancias.
texts.en: Manuela has a business making tortillas. She claims that sometimes sales are bad; they fall, and she has to change to other business alternatives in order to always be making money. She wants to make her business bigger through loans as well as with earnings from the business itself. Yesenia del Socorro has her business selling cosmetics, and now she is also introducing clothing sales. She is asking for the loan for the purchase of cosmetics such as lipstick, creams, treatments, shampoo, perfumes, and other items. She claims that before, her business was much smaller, and that thanks to the loans awarded by Kiva and Fundación León 2000, it has been growing. She also works as a maid, and her husband works as well. She wants to continue investing in her business in order to keep earning.

loans.use: to purchase lipstick, creams, treatments, shampoo, perfumes, and other items

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 50 years old and married with three children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. For the past ten years, Rosita has been raising and selling livestock. She enjoys the good business return she has had from past deals and earns 2,000 PHP each month. Rosita joined GDMPC earlier this year.

Rosita is requesting a 2,000 PHP loan from GDMPC to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She hopes her loan will augment and improve the growth of her animals and improve her potential to sell at a higher rate. In the future, Rosita plans to expand her business to uplift her family's income and provide for day-to-day expenses. She plans to buy more livestock to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and suppplies

loans.name: Joe Ann

texts.en:
Joe Ann is 22 years old and married with two children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. For the past four years, Joe Ann has been a farmer and grows a sort of palay (unmilled rice) to earn a living. She has been unable to escape from the inevitable plant devastation due to natural calamities and unfavorable phenomenon which collectively decreases her production. She joined GDMPC earlier this year. Joe Ann earns an approximate total of 10,000 PHP each month.

Joe Ann is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan from GDMPC to purchase fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to reap a good harvest with her investment and apply appropriate pest-and-insect-killing fertilizer to boost growth and avoid the loss of capital. Joe Ann is planning to expand her business to improve the general living condition of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 53 years old and lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and has two adult children. 

To earn a living, Violeta has a business selling mostly native food snacks like suman, rice cakes, puto, drinks and many others. She does the cooking personally and also accepts consignment of other products for additional income. She earns about PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. 

Violeta has a requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. 

Violeta has been a member of GDMPC since earlier this year. In the future, Violeta would like to improve and expand her business to increase the earnings of the family and provide for the needs of each household member.

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks for the restaurant.

loans.name: Maria Estrella

texts.en:
Maria Estrella is single and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. (Abaca is the fiber of a palm leaf.) Maria Estrella has been in this business for three years. Maria Estrella works hard to support her family. 

Maria Estrella requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her abaca weaving business.

In the future, Maria Estrella would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has an arts products business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from abaca weaving. (Abaca is the fiber of a palm leaf, used in weaving.) Lolita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for her arts products business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her arts products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her business (purchase of counters and shelves)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to sell chicken

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma, 39, is married and has two children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Vilma has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Vilma requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to sell knitted clothing.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. Susan works hard to support her family.

Susan requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Susan would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 49 years old and married. She has five children.

Myrna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Myrna has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 25 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Myrna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to restock her tire repair and tire sales shop.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Narantsetseg is 27 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her eldest son attends kindergarten and her husband helps to manage the family business. 

She started her business by selling ice-cream and drinks at Tamir Market in 2009. Her business is going very well. She is planning to have her own commercial space at the market. She is an honest and diligent woman who says, "I want to expand my business and have constant sales income." 

She is requesting a 1,100,000 MNT loan to purchase a coffee maker and increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase a coffee maker.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 52 years old and married. She has seven children, and five of them are in school. Rosita works very hard to provide for them.

Rosita runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. Rosita has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, soap, oil, spices and canned goods. She has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

In the future Rosita would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a 64-year-old widow with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Editha runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, oil and spices. 

She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries. 

In the future, Editha would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. Erlinda has been in this business for 28 years now.

Erlinda requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza, 43, is a married woman with four children, of whom three are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Analiza has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. Analiza requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Analiza has been in this business for five years. In the future, Analiza would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Otgonoyun

texts.en:
Otgonoyun is 46 years old and lives with her sister and two children in a house in the Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. Her son will soon be a college freshman. 

Otgonoyun operates a sewing business. She started her business in 2004 and she operates her business at her home. 

Her daily income is sufficient to cover all the relevant costs and bring some profit. She manages all the management tasks and duties. She is gradually expanding her business. 

She is a diligent and responsible woman who says, "My business is going well after receiving a loan from the bank. Thus, I want to expand my business." 

She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase materials and cloth for her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials and cloth.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is 64 years old and a widow with six children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Pilar runs a ready-to-wear clothes business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years.
 
She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

In the future, Pilar would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
“To work as hard as I can is one of my goals in life, because I know that as I aim to uplift the life of my family, I really have to make things to make it a reality,” Yolanda said. 

Yolanda Narag is a 49-year-old businesswoman. She is married to Agustin, a furniture worker, and they are blessed with six children and another who has passed away. Their children are Imee Rose, 25, who is married and a high school graduate; Sheryll, 23, who is a college graduate and now working in Manila; Ferdinand, 22, who is in his second year of college; Richard, 19, who is an elementary graduate; Val, 10, and Ramil Jay, 9, who are both studying in their elementary grades. They live in a community where furniture making is the major source of income for most of the residents. 

Yolanda is engaged in the vending business. She put up a small stall in front of their house where her customers go when they need to buy something. Some of her merchandise includes fish and meat. Her store is located beside their small furniture shop, which is managed by her husband. The couple is working hand in hand to make sure that they can provide the needs of their family and the education of their two youngest children.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, fish and fruits for her food stall.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is 48 years old and married. She has six grown children. She has a business where she sells different kinds of vegetables like cabbage, tomatoes, eggplant and beans. She has been in this business for seven years. Rufina is well known for being a responsible person in their community. 

Rufina is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy additional vegetables and fruits to sell in the community. Rufina hopes that someday she can achieve her dream of having a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, eggplant, tomato and beans for her store.

loans.name: Benigna

texts.en: Benigna is a very supportive mother with her children. She lives in her own home together with her beloved husband. Benigna has a business of furniture making where she can sell tables, chairs and beds. Her wish is to be able to see her children become professionals. This is what motivates her to work every day. She has decided to request this loan in order to buy a wood, nails and other materials needed in her shop that will appeal to her customers and allow her to attract new customers. She hopes that this will improve her situation and that she will manage to achieve her dream.

loans.use: to buy nails, wood and other materials needed for her furniture

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina, de 37 años de edad, reside en casa familiar junto a su esposo y su pequeña hija. Ella  se dedica a la venta de verduras: yuca, zanahorias, tomates, cebollas, chiles, güisquiles, etc. ya tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse al negocio y es una de sus principales fuentes de ingresos. Para Luz lo más importante es su familia y sueña con el día en que su situación económica se vea mejorada. Ella trabaja duramente para llevar el pan de cada día a su casa y no se cansa  de hacerlo ya que es el que le brinda la oportunidad de accesar a una mejor calidad de vida. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio con el fin de mantenerlo surtido y que los clientes puedan encontrar siempre lo que buscan. Con el crédito desea comprar mayor variedad de verduras como: yuca, tomates, cebollas, zanahorias, chiles, güisquiles, etc. De esta manera espera que sus ventas se vean incrementadas y logre tener acceso a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is 37 years old and lives in her family home with her husband and young daughter.  She sells vegetables for a living such as yucca, carrots, tomatoes, onions, chilies, güisquiles [edible plant in the gourd family], etc.  She has a lot of time to dedicate to her business and it is one of her main sources of income.  For Luz, what is most important is her family and she dreams of the day when her financial situation is better.  She works very hard every day to provide for her family and she doesn't tire of doing it as she knows this is what will give her the opportunity to give them a better quality of life.  


She made the decision to request a loan with INTEGRAL so she could invest in her business and keep it stocked so her customers can always find what they are looking for.  With the loan she wants to buy a greater variety of vegetables such as yucca, tomatoes, onions, carrots, chilies, güisquiles, etc.  She hopes that this will increase her sales and allow her access to a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase a greater variety of vegetables such as yucca, tomatoes, onions, carrots, chilies, güisquiles, etc.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
RoseMarie, 43 years old, is married with four children. "It's to hard for me to be far with my husband just to earn money in other country just to give our need" shared RoseMarie. That's why she established a grocery store in front of their house; just to help her husband, who worked in another country, and to have another income. 

RoseMarie is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase snack foods, drinks, spices and other needs for her store. She dreams that someday her business will expand to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase snack foods, drinks and spices for her store

loans.name: Lucas

texts.es: Lucas vive con su compañera de vida y sus cinco hijos en casa propia, en zona semi urbana. El posee una tienda en su residencia y está muy surtida con artículos de primera necesidad, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues su tienda se ha vuelto muy famosa en el lugar, porque siempre encuentran lo que necesitan con productos de muy buena calidad a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable ya que don Lucas siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa en su rostro; él es un hombre lleno de energía, activo y con muchas ganas de trabajar, piensa que el coraje y la motivación de llegar al éxito en un futuro  son elementos esenciales en la vida, y él ha tenido el valor de arriesgarse con su negocio para verlo crecer, es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar golosinas, granos básicos, producto instantáneo, pan, bebidas entre otros. Lucas tiene confianza que su labor le permitirá darle a su linda familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Lucas lives with his life partner and their five children in their own house in a semi urban zone.  He runs a store out of his house and it is well stocked with basic necessity products.  Lately, he has gained a lot of customers as his store has become famous because his customers can always find what they need.  He sells good quality products at affordable prices and the service is unbeatable as Don Lucas always greets his customers with a smile.  He is an active and  energetic man who is eager to work.  He believes that courage and motivation are essential to be successful in life and he has had the courage to take risks with his business and see it grow.  It is for this reason that he is requesting a loan with INTEGRAL which will allow him to buy sweets, basic grains, instant products, bread, beverages, and other things.  Lucas is confident that his labor will allow him to give his beautiful family a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase sweets, basic grains, bread, beverages, instant products, etc.

loans.name: Pun

texts.en: Pun (pictured here), 47, is a widow. She lives in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Pun asked for a Kiva loan to lay bricks and plaster the ceiling and walls in order to visually enhance them. She is in the process of doing so and is asking for another loan of $600 to make the finishes.

loans.use: To lay bricks and plaster the ceiling and walls in order to visually enhance them

loans.name: Seik

texts.en: Seik (in the photo) and her husband, Sophorn, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have four children- two sons and two daughters. The couple are farmers. In addition, Seik is a weaver, while her husband is a construction worker. Seik is asking for a loan of 500 USD to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business. She will also use a part of her loan to build a restroom for family use.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business and build a restroom for family use

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coconut, tamarind, nance and sugar.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao (in the photo) is a widow. She lives with her grandson and granddaughter in a village near the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Mao runs grocery store at home. She hopes to generate income by investing with her neighbor in growing mushrooms. So she is asking for a loan to fund her project.

loans.use: to invest with her neighbor in growing mushrooms

loans.name: Ana Matilde

texts.es: Ana Matilde de cuarenta y seis años de edad vive con su compañero de vida en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de mariscos que la realiza de forma ambulante, se levanta desde muy temprano con su esposo a vender, ya se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues los mariscos que comercian siempre están frescos, son de muy buena calidad y los vende a muy buen precio, además el servicio que brinda es excelente y lo da hasta la puerta del hogar de sus clientes, Ana Matilde es una mujer emprendedora muy activa y con ganas de sobresalir en la vida para ella lo más importante es alcanzar la felicidad y es por eso que siempre trabaja duro, con ese pensamiento positivo de sacar su negocio adelante se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar, pescado, camarones, conchas, entre otros. Ana Matilde tiene la esperanza que así lograra llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Ana Matilde, 46, lives with her life partner in their own house.  She’s a seafood street vendor.  She rises very early with her husband to go out selling because she’s attained quite a large clientele because the seafood they sell is always fresh, of good quality and she sells it at a very good price.  Besides, the service she provides is excellent and she even goes to her customers’ doorsteps to provide it.

Ana Matilde is a very enterprising, very active woman with a strong drive to stand out in life.  For her, what’s most important is to attain happiness and this is why she works hard always with this positive attitude to make her business succeed.  She decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to buy fish, shrimp and conch, among others.  Ana Matilde hopes this way to bring economic security to her home.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp and conch.

loans.name: Vyreak

texts.en:
Vyreak (in the photo) and his wife, Seangly, live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have two sons and one daughter.

Vyreak is a farmer and drives a motor taxi when he is free from farming. His wife is a weaver and also assists her husband in farming. Vyreak is requesting a loan of $200 to buy a water pump and to repair his motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a water pump and to repair his motorbike.

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Sreng (in the photo) sells fruits. His wife, Rinratha, stays at home and does house work. They live along National Road Number 6, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have one son and two daughters. 

Sreng is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike to carry fruits to market. He does not have his own motorbike and he has to spend a lot of money to carry his fruits.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to carry fruits to market.

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en:
Sarun (in the photo) is a rice farmer. She lives along National Road Five, about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has one son and two daughters. One of her children is married and the other two are garment workers. 

Sarun is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase one more cow to assist her by plowing her rice farmland.

loans.use: To purchase one more cow for plowing her farmland.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: Consuelo de cuarenta años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de ropa en el lugar de su residencia últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues la ropa que vende es de muy buena calidad y claro a un buen precio, tiene diferentes tipos y estilos faldas cortas y largas, vestidos, pantalones, trajes de niño, calcetines entre otros, todo para hombre o mujer; Consuelo es una mujer de trabajo siempre esta activa y con ganas de estar adelante de la competencia se levanta desde muy temprano a vender pues tiene el lema de a quien madruga Dios le ayuda, con ese pensamiento positivo quiere surtir mas el negocio para que crezca es por eso que le solicito a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar, camisetas, pantalones, blusas, ropa interior etc. Así siempre estará a disposición de las necesidades de los clientes. Consuelo tiene la confianza que así lograra darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Consuelo, 40, lives with her life partner and three children in her own house.  She sells clothes from home and has lately acquired quite a large clientele because the clothes she sells are of very good quality and, of course, very good price.  She has a variety of styles and types: short and long skirts, dresses, pants, children’s outfits and socks, among others, for both men and women.

Consuelo is a woman who works; she’s always busy wanting to stay ahead of the competition.  She rises very early to sell because she feels that God help she who rises early.  With this positive attitude she wants to better sort her business so that it will grow and this is why she’s asked INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy t-shirts, pants, blouses, underwear, etc. so that she’ll always be able to meet customer demand.  Consuelo trusts that she’ll be able to provide her family with a full life this way.

loans.use: ropa interior to buy clothes.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch (in the photo) is 59 years old and her husband, Seap, is 59 years old.  They live along National Road Number 6, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have five children (two sons and three daughters). Two are married and live outside the family home, one is a chef for a garment factory, one is a construction worker, and another one is in school.   

Touch and her husband are rice farmers. Besides farming, Touch also sells cakes in her village, and her husband is a fisherman. 

Touch is asking for a loan of $400 to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Chhan

texts.en:
Chhan and her husband Savon (pictured together) have been married since 1978. They live along National Road Number Six, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Chhan and her husband are rice farmers. They also supplement their livelihood with a new fish farming business. Chhan is asking for a loan of $700 to buy a motorbike for her children to drive to school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children to drive to school.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dairy products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Pheary

texts.en: Pheary is newly-married to her second husband and has three sons. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about 25 kilometers from the center of town. Pheary earns a living by selling rice in a local market, while her husband drives a taxi. She is asking for a loan of $600 to buy more rice to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Thuok

texts.en: Thuok (who we see here with her loom) makes a living as a weaver. She is a widow who is raising six children -- three sons and three daughters. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 from Phnom Penh City. Thouk is seeking a new loan, for $300, to continue her weaving business by buying material with which to make garments and other items.

loans.use: to buy materials for a weaving business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay off the remaining debt on a minivan.

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Vanny is a security guard, while his wife is a weaver. They live on an island of the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have five children. Vanny is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike to drive to work.  

Photo: Vanny and his wife.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to drive to work.

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Vuthy is a fisherman and does construction work. His wife, Vanna is a weaver. They live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have five children (two sons and three daughters). Three attend school and the other two are still too young for school. 

Vuthy is requesting a loan of $100 to buy new fishing nets because the ones he has now are old.
Photo: Vuthy and his wife.

loans.use: To buy new fishing nets.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga and her husband are vegetable farmers. They live on an island of the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three children (two sons and one daughter). 

Nga is asking for another loan of $400 to pay school fees for her son, who is attending university. It is the last year of his bachelors degree.
Photo: Nga and her husband.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her son.

loans.name: Len

texts.en:
Len, 50 years old, sells sweets and can earn $4 per day for her income. Her husband is a policeman and earns $2 per day. She has three children.  One is studying and the other two are working in the factory, with $6 per day for all.  Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $7 on electricity, $12 on rent house fee, $7 on school fee, $10 on transportation and $15 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy coffee beans and other necessities for her daughter to sell coffee from home. This loan will help her daughter to have her own career to support herself and the family also.

loans.use: To buy coffee beans and other necessities for her daughter to sell coffee

loans.name: Zina

texts.en:
Zina is a resident of Tup, a small village in the eastern part of Kyrgyzstan. She is 43 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she brings up three sons and a daughter. The oldest son entered the university and the two other sons study at school.  The daughter is preschool age (under seven). Zina works as a teacher of Russian language at school. In order to earn additional money to meet the family needs, she sells dairy products. The family also cultivates agricultural products. This year they grow wheat and barley.  

Zina applied for the loan because she needs additional funds to purchase 200 liters of fuel, which is needed for collecting the harvest. Part of the loan will be used to pay for tractor services. In the near future, with the profits gained from selling the harvest, Zina wants to improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and to pay for tractor services

loans.name: Kem

texts.en: Kem is 39 years old and earns $1 a day as a farmer. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $4 a day. They have two children, both of whom are in school. The family's monthly expenses include $30 for food, $3 for electricity, $8 for school fees, $10 on transportation and $13 on other items. Kem is applying for a loan for $500 to buy a motorbike which her husband can use to travel to and from work, and a cow if possible. In the future, she would like to open a grocery store in her home.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to use for commuting.

loans.name: Seyet

texts.en:
Seyet (in the photo) and her husband, Ly, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have two young children--one son and one daughter. 

Seyet is a weaver, and her husband is a car repairman. Seyet also buys additional silk products from other weavers in her village for resale. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase silk products for sale and repair the house where she lives.

loans.use: To purchase silk products for sale and repair the house where she lives.

loans.name: Pichthary

texts.en:
Pichthary, 28, is a farmer. Her husband sells food, and their income is $8 per day. She has two children, three and one year old. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on transportation and $15 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she hopes to have enough money to send all of her children to study in the university.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family

loans.name: Khonthea

texts.en:
Khonthea and her husband, Englong, have been married since 2007 and have a young son. They live along National Road Number Six, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Khonthea stays at home and does housework. The main source of income is from her husband's fishing business. Khonthea is asking for a loan of $300 to assist her husband in his fishing business by buying a boat.

loans.use: To buy a boat for her husband's fishing business.

loans.name: Rahat

texts.en:
Rahat, 53, is the resident of Tup, a nice village in the Isykul region. Together with her husband, who is a farmer, she has raised five daughters. The eldest daughter is married and lives separately with her family, and the other daughters are students. 

Rahat works as a primary school teacher; in order to contribute additional money to the family budget she also sells milk (about 10 liters a day). The family also cultivates agricultural products, this year her husband is growing wheat. 

Rahat applied for the loan because they need money to purchase fuel for collecting the harvest. With the profits gained from selling the harvest she will pay for family expenses (for example, the daughters' university tuition). 

---Where Did This Loan Come From?---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team-Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for collecting the harvest

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Kheng (in the photo) is 38 years old and his wife, Pesoet, is 34 years old. They live about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have one son and one daughter. Both of their children are in school. 

Kheng is a motor taxi driver, while his wife is a garment worker. He is asking for a loan of $700 to repair the house where he lives.

loans.use: To repair the house where he lives.

loans.name: Na

texts.en: Na, 57 years old, is selling groceries at home with $2.5 per day for her income. She is a single mother with one daughter who works in a factory making $2.5 per day. Every month, she has to spend $33 on food, $6 on electricity, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $300 to buy a sewing machine for her daughter to sew at home so that she doesn’t have to travel to work far from the house. She hopes to have more money to extend her business and her daughter’s business as well.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her daughter

loans.name: Prouen

texts.en: Prouen, 50 years old, is a housewife. Her husband is a farmer with $3 per day for his income. She has five children, three are studying and other two are working making $3 per day each. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $4 on electricity, $12 on school fees, $3 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for her children to use traveling to study. In the future, she wants to raise animals like pigs or chickens at home so that she can help her husband earn some money to support the family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children to use traveling to study

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Im, 40 years old, is a housewife. Her husband is a farmer with $3 per day for his income. She has three children, two are studying and one is working in the factory with $4 per day for her income. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $4 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $5 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a hand tractor for plowing. In the future, she wants to send her children to study in the university so that they can have a good jobs to support themselves.

loans.use: To buy a hand tractor for plowing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to sell sodas and sweets.

loans.name: Janbolot

texts.en:
Janbolot, 40, is married. Together with his wife he brings up four daughters and a son. The older daughter is married and lives separately with her family. The younger daughter is preschool age. Janbolot’s wife takes care of her and the other children study at school. Five years ago Janbolot sold a potato harvest and with an initial investment of 20000 soms he started to breed cattle. Reselling cattle after fattening them he earns about 4000 soms per month. This profit made him able to build a summer kitchen. He also purchased furniture and improved the family’s living conditions. With money received from the loan he wants to purchase a horse for breeding. In the future Janbolot wants to increase the number of cattle and provide his children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a horse for breeding

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Say runs a grocery store at her home. She is a widow with four sons. She lives along national road number one about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Say has asked for Kiva loan several times already. She now is requesting another loan of $600 to buy more groceries for her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her inventory.

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
Soy, 50 years old, is a housewife. Her husband is a farmer, with $3 per day for his income. She has four children, two of whom are studying and two of whom are working in the factory earning $3 per day each. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $4 on electricity, $10 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy animals to raise and sell. She hopes her new career will be successful so that she can get more animals to a make good income.  She wants to support her children to study in the university when they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy animals for feeding and selling

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Yat (in the photo) is a weaver, while her husband is a construction worker. They have a young daughter. They are living on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  

Yat is requesting a loan of $200 to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to sell clothes

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Channy, 38 years old, is a garment factory worker earning $2 a day. Her husband is also working in the factory and earns $2 per day. She has two children, 17 and 12 years old. Both of them are studying at school. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $10 on school fees, $5 on electricity, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for her and her husband to travel to work. She hopes that she can have the ability to support the two children to study through high school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her and her husband to travel to work

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en:
Nazira is 37 years old.  She is married to a farmer with whom she brings up three daughters and three sons. The youngest son is a newborn baby and all the other children are at school. Nazira owns a grocery store, where she sells foodstuffs. Fifteen years ago her husband got ten farm animals as an inheritance from his parents. Since that moment the husband has been breeding cattle in order to earn additional funds to cover daily expenses.  Nazira sells milk (about 20 liters a day).  

Nazira applied for the loan because she needs funds to purchase two bull-calves for breeding, fattening and further selling.  In the future, with the profits gained from selling cattle, she wants to finish house construction of a house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase bull-calves for breeding, fattening and selling

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Yat (in the photo), 53, is a widow with seven children. Four are married and live outside the family home, one is a garment worker, one has full-time employment, and another one is bicycle repairman. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Yat is a rice farmer. She is asking for a loan of $300 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Kimhun

texts.en:
Kimhun, 31 years old, is a food seller with $7.50 per day for her income. Her husband is a worker with $6 per day for his income. She has four children; one is studying and other three have not started school yet because they are too young. Besides her family, she is also living with one brother and one sister. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, $8 on electricity, $10 on school fees, and $20 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for use in the family. In the future, she wants to buy a stock of rice to resell and repair her house when she has enough money.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use.

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Nary (in the photo) is single and 20 years old. He lives with his widowed mother on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Nary is a wooden house repairman. He is requesting his first loan in the amount of $800 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Sophan

texts.en:
Sophan (pictured here) is a construction worker. His wife, Sambo is a garment worker. They live in a village along National Road Number Three, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1990 and have four sons and one daughter.  

Sophan is asking for another loan of $300 to put an addition on his house.

loans.use: To put an addition on his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Kulbara

texts.en:
Kulbara is a resident of Tup, a small nice village in the eastern part of Kyrgyzstan. She is 43 and married to a farmer, and together with him she is bringing up a daughter and two sons. Their daughter is married and lives separately with her family; their older son studies at school and the younger son is preschool age (under seven). 

Kulbara works as a teacher of mathematics at a school; she earns additional money for the family budget by selling milk products. Five years ago with an initial investment of 5000 soms the family started to breed cattle. With money received from the loan Kulbara wants to purchase two bull-calves for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future she wants to provide her sons with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase two bull-calves.

loans.name: Neav

texts.en:
Neav, 48 years old, is a farmer with her husband; their income is $8 per day. She has seven children; three are studying, and the other four are working with $11 per day for all. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy two cows for doing farming. This couple never think of changing their career as farmers. They even plan to do more farming if they have the ability to buy more rice field to cultivate.

loans.use: To buy two cows for doing farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Sokhom, 51 years old, sells Chinese fried noodles earning $4 per day. Her husband is a Tok Tok driver and can earn $6 per day for his income. She has four children, three are studying and one more is working at $5 per day. Every month, she has to spend $100 on food, $5 on electricity, $25 on school fees, and $15 on transportation.

 She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a new "Tok Tok" for her husband's career. In the future, she wants to buy some grocery goods to sell at the primary school. She will try to support her children to study and at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a new "Tok Tok" for her husband's career.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to sell chicken.

loans.name: Soth

texts.en:
Soth, 41 years old, sells eggs earning $10 per day. Her husband is a carpenter with $4 per day for his income. She has two children, and both of them are studying. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, $5 on electricity, and $10 for other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for her husband's motor taxi service.

 In the future, she wants to have a better store where she can sell eggs. For her children, she wants to support them to study until they finish university so that they can get a good job to do.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband's motor taxi service.

loans.name: Kean

texts.en:
Kean, 43 years old, sells pigs with $5 per day for her income. Her husband is working in a hotel at $3 per day. She has five children; four are studying and one more is working as a waiter in a hotel at $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on rent, $15 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $400 to buy a computer for her children's studies. She hopes her children will be able to use the computer well so that they can find good job to do in the future.

loans.use: To buy a computer for her children's studies.

loans.name: Saron

texts.en:
Saron, 24 years old, is a musician earning $10 per day. His wife is a singer with $5 per day as her income. This couple has one son who is two years old. Every month, he has to spend $75 on food, $8 on electricity, $30 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. 

He would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy musical instruments and rent them to the restaurant where he is working. Because he likes music he plans to create a big band and buy more instruments for this career.

loans.use: To buy musical instruments.

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.en:
Ainagul is a resident of Tup. She is 51 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she has raised two daughters and a son. The daughters are married and live separately with their families, and the son studies at school. Sixteen years ago, in 1996, due to the high unemployment rate the family started to breed livestock. With an initial investment of 4000 soms Ainagul purchased five livestock animals for breeding.

Reselling livestock after fattening the family earns additional money to meet their daily needs. With money received from the loan, Ainagul wants to purchase cattle for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the near future, with the profits gained from reselling cattle, she wants to purchase a fridge to improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Chanthorn, a 31-year-old tuk tuk (auto rickshaw) driver earning $8 per day, has two children, both yet too young to attend school. His wife used to sell vegetables, but has been at home since the birth of their last child. Each month, Chanthorn spends $75 on food, $5 on electricity, $30 on transportation and $10 on other expenses.

He would like to request a loan of $400 to buy a new tuk tuk for his business. His wife plans to resume selling vegetables soon.

loans.use: to buy a new tuk tuk for his business.

loans.name: Gnek

texts.en:
Gnek, a 32-year-old father of three children, two of whom attend school, is married to a farmer who earns $3 per day. Gnek earns about $5 per day selling  souvenirs. Every month, he has to spend $66 on food, and $10 on other expenses. 

Now requesting a loan of $300 to buy more souvenirs to sell, Gnek hopes to increase his income and eventually buy a store to retail his goods.

loans.use: to buy more souvenirs to sell.

loans.name: Sinoun

texts.en:
Sinoun, a 31-year-old farmer, is married to a tuk tuk (auto rickshaw) driver. Their income is $10 per day. This couple has four children, all of them students. Every month, Sinoun has to spend $35 on food, $10 on electricity, $20 on school fees, and $75 on transportation.

Sinoun is requesting a loan to buy a new tuk tuk for her husband, as his current one is old and in need of frequent repairs. In the future, she wants to buy a sugarcane squeezing machine to sell sugarcane juice in front of her house, and hopes to be able to send her children to university when they finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a new tuk tuk for her husband.

loans.name: Lak

texts.en:
Lak is 31 year old and sells drawings. Her husband band is an artist, and they have two children, one of whom is a student.

Lak and her husband earn about $15 per day. Each month, they spend about $90 on food, $8 on electricity, $80 on rent, $10 on school fees, and $10 on transportation. She plans to use this loan of $700 to rent a space at the market where she will sell drawings. In the future, she wants to expand her shop, and perhaps wholesale drawings as well.

loans.use: to rent a space at a market from which to sell drawings

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 45 years old and single. He helps his parents provide for the needs the family, including his siblings' education. Emmanuel did not have the opportunity to go to college.  He is willing to make sacrifices for his siblings and he hopes they will also help him at times when he's in need.

He has been a "tricycle" (motorcycle taxi with sidecar) operator for about six months, and earns about 180 Philippine pesos (PHP) per day. It is not much, but Emmanuel says, ”It is better to gain a little than to gain nothing”.

Emmanuel plans to use this 6,000 PHP loan to buy oil and paint for his motorcycle taxi.  He also plans to use part of the loan to purchase gasoline.

loans.use: to buy oil, gasoline, and paint for a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 54 years old and married to Benito who is a farmer in the village where they live. The couple is blessed with two children. To boost her family's household's income, Pacita established a sari-sari (variety) store in front of her house. The daily net profit of 200 Philippine pesos (PHP) is just enough to cover the cost of daily meals and allowances for her children.

After four years of sacrifices, Pacita was very proud when her eldest child graduated from school.  That child now works at a restaurant, and sometimes helps Pacita by givng her money for the other child in the family, who is still a high school student.

Pacita plans to use this loan of 50,000 PHP to buy more grocery items, such as soft drinks, biscuits, breads and eggs, to sell in her sari-sari store. She wants to generate more income so she's able to save for her youngest daughter's college education.

In the future, Pacita dreams of managing a mini-grocery in their village to make herself more financially stable.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, biscuits, breads and eggs as inventory for a small retail store

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en: Altantuya is 36 years old and lives with her husband in a house in Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband helps with the family business. Altantuya operates a salt trading business. She started her business in 2004 at Han-Ord market. She has gained a lot of business experience. Her husband supports the family business a lot. She is a diligent person who is requesting 1,800,000 MNT loan to purchase salt.

loans.use: To purchase salt

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en:
Ophelia, who lives with her husband and four children, has been selling cosmetic products and toilet cleaners within their village for three years. The profits have provided support for her family.

Ophelia, who hopes to support her children's studies until they complete college to ensure a good future, is requesting a loan of P25,000  to buy more products such as cosmetics, lotion, toilet cleaners and underwear for her business.  She also hopes to satisfy customer demand through this increased range of products.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products, lotion, toilet cleaners and underwear for her direct-selling business.

loans.name: Federico

texts.en:
Federico greatly enjoys life with his wife and child. An optimistic person hoping to someday provide a better living standard for his family, he plants and harvests rice to sell to village traders, usually earning a yield amounting to P16,000 twice year.

Federico is requesting a loan of P10,000 to buy seeds and pesticides to prepare his farmland to produce an abundant harvest next season. In the future, he would like to achieve a better yield to save for any emergencies that might arise.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Ulziihuu

texts.en:
Ulziihuu is 53 years old and lives with her daughter in a house in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her daughter works as a nurse at the local hospital. Ulziihuu operates a sewing business. She started to sew clothes in 1995. 

She moved to the Bayan-Burd market and opened her tailoring and fashion shop. She has many years of tailoring and business experience. She is a diligent woman who is requesting a 2,300,000 MNT loan to buy more cloth for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cloth

loans.name: Lusvisminda

texts.en:
Lusvisminda is 48 years old and widowed with 6 children.

Lusvisminda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc in her sari sari store.

Lusvisminda has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF. She has been running the sari sari store for 11 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Lusvisminda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Casimiro

texts.en:
Casimiro has been managing his two-hectare rice field for almost 20 years. He has been exerting more effort in maintaining his crop to produce better yield.

He is 58 years old and married having five children who are in school. Casimiro's children serve as an inspiration for him in pursuing his dreams of providing them with a good education and a successful life despite his poverty. 

Casimiro is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy hybrid seeds, insecticides and herbicides used in farming. With the help of this loan he can provide enough sustenance for his crop and produce a bountiful harvest. 

Casimiro wants to enjoy the fruits of his sacrifices. He wants to see his children earn their degrees and obtain good employment someday.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds, insecticides and herbicides used in farming

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of 7 children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a bakery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her bakery business.

Evelyn has sustained her business activities throughout the 18 loans she has requested and repaid from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business and to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Airah

texts.en:
Airah is 22 years old and married with 1 child.

Airah works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her sari-sari store.

Airah has borrowed and repaid twice from NWTF before this request. She has been running the sari sari store for a year and also earns an income from buying & selling of dried fish.

Airah aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks to sell in her sari-sari store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Amarmurun

texts.en: Amarmurun is 43 years old and lives with her two children and husband in a Mongolian yurt in Huvsgul, a province of Mongolia. Her daughter is a high school student. Amarmurun operates a business selling dairy products. She started her business in 2000. Now she is cooperating with another person to manage the business. Her husband also sells nuts and fruits at the same local market. She is an open-minded and diligent woman who says "Next year, my daughter will be a college student. Thus, I need to pay her college tuition fee and other expenses by increasing my sales. I think that I will have no time to relax." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase dairy products, fruits and nuts at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To purchase dairy products, fruits and nuts at wholesale prices

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en: Davaasuren is 52 years old and lives with her two children and husband in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband supports the family business. Davaasuren operates a grocery products trading business. She started her business in 1991 at Han-Ord local market. She has many years of business experience. She has started to build a house with the profits she earned from the business. She is a diligent woman who is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more products at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To purchase more products at the wholesale price

loans.name: Isagani

texts.en:
Isagani is 34 years old and is married. They raise three children together. To generate income, they are both involved in business. Isagani's spouse raises hogs while he plants and harvests rice for future sale. He usually sells it to traders in the village and earns a yield of P30,000 twice a year. He has been raising crops in his two-hectare rice field for almost five years. The expensive cost of commodities makes him strive harder since his children are now attending school and need a daily allowance. 

He is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy seeds, pesticides and moluscicides used in farming. Through the help of this loan, he will improve his crop production. 

In the future, Isagani would like to produce better crops and make his family financially stable.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides and moluscicides used in farming.

loans.name: Genilyn

texts.en:
Genilyn works hard to support her family. Genilyn is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Genilyn requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing materials.

Genilyn has been in this business for a year now.

In the future, Genilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fishing net and other fishing materials

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a married parent of 6 children, Lorna works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Lorna is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 29 years old, married to Micheal and they have one child aged four years old. She has been selling second-hand clothes for the last two years, making a monthly profit of KES 8,800. She has been loaned KES 10,000, which she plans to use to buy more stock of clothes for sale.

With the anticipated profits, she plans to purchase household items and improve her business. She hopes to build her own business premise and become a supplier of second-hand clothes.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
With his desire to improve his family's living conditions, Marlon patiently endures the pain of managing his farming business. According to Marlon, farming is not an easy type of work as a source of income. One must strive hard to provide sustenance for the crops to achieve an abundant harvest. 

He is 33 years old and had been cultivating his farm for almost 10 years. Marlon earned about PHP 30,000 at the last cropping season in May from his own farm land. Net income earned every harvest is used to sustain the education of his three children.

Marlon is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 due to insufficient funds to buy the seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. With the help of this loan, he can improve his rice production. 

Marlon hopes to continue growing as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Nolibeth

texts.en:
Nolibeth is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nolibeth is 26 years old and one of her children is in school.

Nolibeth has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Nolibeth requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her business.

Nolibeth has been in this business for a year.  In the future, Nolibeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 50 years old and has three children. Norma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Norma has borrowed and paid three prior loans from NWTF. She has been running the sari-sari store for a year, and she also earns an income from selling fish. Norma hopes to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Oktyabri

texts.en: Oktyabri is 25 years old and lives with his two children and wife in a ger (a portable dwelling) in the Hovd province of Mongolia.  His wife retails vegetables at the local market.  Oktyabri started his business in 2003 and since then, has done several different types of businesses.  In the begining, he worked at a construction site.  In 2010, he purchased a car, and he has been serving as a taxi driver ever since.  He is planning to build a house and a fence on his new land which he just purchased.  He is a diligent man who is requesting a 1,600,000 MNT loan to purchase vegetables at wholesale prices for his wife who sells them in the city of Ulaanbaayar.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables at wholesale prices for his wife to sell at the market.

loans.name: Teresita
