texts.en: Teresita, who is married, works hard to support her family with her enterprise of buying and selling used materials in the Philippines. In this business for five years now, she has requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to send her children to college and to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to sell.

loans.name: Surenhuu

texts.en: Surenhuu is 43 years old and lives with her husband and children in a house in the province of Hovd, Mongolia. Her husband works at a construction site. She started her business in 1998 by selling flour. She has many years of working experience. With the profits she earned, she is paying her two children's college tuition fees. In the future, she plans to redecorate her house. She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrik loan to purchase flour at wholesale prices.

loans.use: to purchase flour at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 56 years old, married, and has four children.  They live in Turod Norte Cordon. She sells fish while her husband manages their rice fields. He also helps her with selling fish within their village.  Elvira uses her income to pay the electric bill and for her family's daily needs. 

Due to high cost of basic commodities, Elvira is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase fish such as tilapia and milkfish to sell. Elvira hopes to  increase her profits so that she can sustain the financial needs of the family and save money for the future. She believes that through her patience in managing her business she will be able to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to  buy tilapia and milkfish for her fish selling business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is married and has a sound system business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for a year now. Lorna works hard to support her family. 

Lorna requested a 12,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for her business. In the future, Lorna would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for her business

loans.name: Sharapat's Group

texts.en:
Sharapat is the leader of this group.  She is 55, and unfortunately she is a widow.  She has raised two sons.  Her first son is married and lives separately with his family, and her second son studies at school. 

In order to earn money to meet the family's needs, Sharapat breeds livestock.  She has been in this business for a long time.  She earns 2,000 Kyrgyzstani soms per month by reselling livestock after fattening.  

With the money received from this loan, she wants to purchase feed for her livestock. In the future Sharapat wishes to purchase a piece of land to start building a house for her sons.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 21 years old and married to Festus.  They do not have any children at the moment.  She has been running her restaurant for the past nine months and making a monthly profit of KES 5,000.  This is her first loan.

Pauline has been loaned KES 10,000, and she plans to expand her restaurant by adding more chairs, tables, etc.  With the anticipated profit made, she plans to open another restaurant.  She hopes to expand in the region and establish herself well.

loans.use: to expand her restaurant by adding more chairs, tables, etc.

loans.name: Gulzada's Group

texts.en:
Gulzada is the treasurer of this group. She is 49 years old and married to a builder. Together with her husband, she has raised a 21-year-old son who also works in construction. 

Twelve years ago with an initial investment of 20,000 Kyrgyzstani soms, Gulzada started breeding livestock.  She earns an additional 2,500 Kyrgyzstani soms to add to the family's budget by reselling livestock after fattening.  

With the money received from this loan, she wants to purchase more livestock. In the future she dreams of purchasing a house in Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan). 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock.

loans.name: Mwero Ngauma

texts.en: Mwero is a single 30-years-old man who does not have children of his own yet. His business is located at the busy Mwembe Tayari in Mombasa. He sells music discs and tapes to the local people in Mombasa. He has been in this business for ten years. He says that the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is the harrassment they get from the local government. However, he works hard from early morning until late evening to keep his business well performing. He is using his loan of KES 20,000 to buy more music discs and cassettes to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business and, in the future, open a stall in Mwembe Tayari. He describes himself as honest and respectful.

loans.use: to buy music discs and cassettes

loans.name: Jelagat

texts.en:
Jelagat is 27 years old, married to Enock. She supports a family of four people. She operates a retail shop and has been in this business for a period of two years. She earns a monthly income of KES.7000.

She has applied for a loan of  KES.20,000 from KADET LTD and plans to use the loan to add more stock for sale at the shop like sugar, soft drinks, and washing detergents. 


She plans to use the anticipated profit to purchase more stock and improve the business, buy more sheep for rearing, and a plot of land. This is her first loan with KADET LTD. Her dreams for her future business are to expand and to have a wholesale business to help her family.

loans.use: To expand the business by adding more stock for sale

loans.name: Satkynbu's Group

texts.en:
Satkynbu is the treasurer of this group. She is 56 years old and divorced. She has raised a son who is 25 years old and works in Russia. Satkynbu works as a teacher. In two years she saved 7000 soms from her salary and with the money she started breeding livestock. By reselling livestock after fattening it, she earns an additional 1000 soms to meet her daily needs. Satkynbu applied for the loan because she needed additional financial resources for purchasing more livestock. She wants to spend some part of the funds from this loan on purchasing furniture to improve the family’s living conditions. In the future, she wants to build a shed with the profits gained from reselling livestock.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and home furniture

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 47 years old. He is married with two children. He has been running a retail shop for the past two years, earning a monthly income of KES 5,500 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Samson will use the loan to buy rice, cooking fat, and sugar to add to his shop inventory. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop which will satisfy their needs.

loans.use: To buy rice, cooking fat, and sugar to add to his shop inventory

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 60 years old and married to Jeniffer. They have been blessed with six children who are now all adults. He has been operating his quarrying business for the past two years making a monthly profit of KES.16,000. This will be his first loan. He has been loaned KES.30,000 which he plans to use for the purchase of another quarrying site.

With the anticipated profit, he plans to open another business in the area. In the near future, he hopes to purchase a lorry that will assist in transportation.

loans.use: to purchase another quarrying site

loans.name: Muoki

texts.en:
Muoki is 41 years old and single. He runs a malimali in Kibera, Nairobi, Kenya, supplying his products to the residents of Kibera. He has been doing this business for the last year and makes an income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month.

Muoki was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a friend who is also a client of KADET. Muoki has got a good credit history with KADET and he is applying for his second loan of 15,000 KES from KADET Ltd., which he plans to use to add more stock of malimali – that is plastic items like basins, jugs, buckets and thermos. He will use the extra profit to open another malimali. Muoki hopes to have a big shop of malimali. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: to add more stock of malimali (that is assorted goods) for sale.

loans.name: 3.4.3 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Dậu works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.  She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Dậu is 54 years old. She is married and has 3 children.  She is the leader of a 5-member group: the 3.4.3 Quảng Hưng solidarity group. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, and has 1 dependent.

This is  Dậu's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Dậu hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids,  and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle

loans.name: Erkeaiym's Group

texts.en:
Erkeaiym is the leader of this group. She is 53 years old and is married to a driver. Together with her husband she has raised four sons, the youngest son is still in school, the oldest son is married and lives separately with his family, and the other two sons work in construction. 

Erkaiym is engaged in livestock breeding.  She started this activity ten years ago with an initial investment of 7,000 soms. From reselling the livestock,  she earns about 3,000 soms per month. Erkaiym applied for this loan because she needs additional money to purchase furniture for her home. With the money received from the loan she wants to improve her family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase furniture

loans.name: Zulfu

texts.ru:
Zulfu jenat i imeyet 2 detey. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Zulfu 55 let. 
On uje 9 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i rozvodit korov. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korov dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota dlya prodaji.
texts.en: Zulfu is married and has two children.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person), who moved from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with his family.  Zulfu is 55 years old.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for nine years and breeds cattle.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy cows and increase the quantity of livestock for future resale.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Mushfig

texts.ru: Mushvig 45 let. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit ocev dlya uvelicheniya kolichestvo skota. Mushvig uje 12 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit ovec.
texts.en: Mushfig is 45 years old, married and has three children.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person), who moved from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with his wife and children.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN to buy sheep in order to increase livestock quantity.  Mushfig has been involved in animal husbandry for 12 years and breeds sheep.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Alima

texts.fr:
Madame Alima est une femme mariée de 51ans et mère de 5 enfants qui vit avec son époux et ses enfants dans la ville de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fréquentée l’école moderne, très vite elle commença les activités génératrices de revenus. Alima après avoir tenté plusieurs activités notamment l’achat et la vente de chaussures, mais sans succès, décide de se spécialiser dans l’achat vente des produits céréaliers tels l’arachide. Elle a appris cette activité auprès de son époux.
Avec une expérience de plus de 5 années, elle maîtrise bien son activité et est très appréciée des ménagères et des transformatrices d’arachides en pâte, cacahouète,  etc .
Pour agrandir son entreprise, elle décide d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elle est à sa première expérience.
Alima compte utiliser son prêt  pour acheter, 10 sacs d’arachides.
Elle s’approvisionne à Bougouni auprès des grossistes et dans les villages environnants auprès des producteurs en période des récoltes. Alima effectue sa vente en détail au comptant et à crédit au marché de Bougouni à une clientèle constituée essentiellement de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA servira payer le prêt, contribuer aux dépenses de la famille et investir dans l’activité.
texts.en:
Madame Alima is a 51 year-old married mother of five, who lives with her husband and children in the Torakabougou quarter of Bougouni. She did not attend a modern school, and so soon began to generate profits by selling various goods for a living. Alima tried her hand at various types of work, including buying and selling shoes, but with limited success, so she decided to specialise in the sale of cereals such as peanuts. She learned her trade from her husband. 
With around 5 years' experience she is successful in her trade and highly regarded by housewives and peanut-butter producers. 
She is seeking her first loan from Soro Yiriwaso in order to boost her business. She aims to use her loan to purchase 10 bags of peanuts. She sources her goods from wholesalers in Bougouni and from peanut growers in the neighbouring villages. 
She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA which will repay the loan, contribute to her family's expenses and be invested in the business.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr:
Monsieur Daouda est un homme marié de 42 ans et père de 3 enfants, qui vit dans une famille traditionnelle, avec sa femme, ses enfants  et ses parents à Faraba, des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni.(région de Sikasso)
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école moderne, dès son jeune âge il commença les activités génératrices de revenus, avec l’apprentissage du métier paternel à savoir les activités de fabrication de marmites et autres objets utilitaires auprès de son père dans une forge. Nanti de plus de 20 ans d’expérience dans le domaine, Daouda maîtrise son activité et est  beaucoup sollicité. Ayant fait la connaissance de Soro Yiriwaso à travers un autre client de l’institution, il décida de rejoindre la structure afin de renforcer d’avantage son pouvoir d’achat.
En effet il compte acheter avec son prêt, 50 kg d'aluminium et 20 sacs de charbon  de bois.Il est à son deuxième prêt avec avec Soro Yiriwaso et le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.                                                                                                                                                                              Il s'approvisionne en aluminium à Bougouni et à Bamako (capitale de république du Mali). La vente de sa production se fait au marché de Bougouni et dans les villages environnants les jours de marchés hebdomadaires.  La plus part de ses clients sont des femmes
Il  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et réutilisé dans l’entreprise.
texts.en: Mr. Daouda is a 42-year-old married man with 3 children, who lives in a traditional family with his wife, his children, and his parents in Faraba, neighborhoods in the city of Bougouni (Sikasso region). Having not attended modern school, he has been working for a living since he was young, having trained in his father’s occupation, namely the production of cooking pots and other practical objects with his father in a forge. With more than 20 years of experience under his belt, Daouda has mastered this business and is very much in demand. Having met Soro Yiriwaso through another of their clients, he decided to join the organization in order to increase his buying power. Indeed, he plans to buy with his loan 50 kg of aluminum and 20 bags of charcoal. He is on his second loan with Soro Yiriwaso and the previous loan was repaid. He stocks up on aluminum in Bougouni and in Bamako (capital of the republic of Mali). He sells his merchandise in the Bougouni market and in neighboring villages on weekly market days. Most of his customers are women. He hopes to earn 60,000 FCFA monthly, which will be used to repay the loan and put back into his business.

loans.use: to buy aluminum

loans.name: Elmira's Group

texts.en:
Elmira is the leader of this group. She is 40 years old and unfortunately is a widow. She is bringing up three children, all of whom are in school. Two years ago, with an initial investment of 10,000 soms, Elmira started a business sewing Kyrgyz national clothing, pillows, blankets and selling dressmaking supplies.  From this work, she earns about 8,000 soms per month. 

Elmira applied for this loan because she needs additional funds to purchase more fabrics and materials which are needed for sewing. In the future, with the profits gained from the business Elmira wants to purchase a new sewing machine.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials

loans.name: Bara Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BARA est composé de quatre femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 24 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles à Massablacoura un des quartiers de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et augmenter le niveau de leur activité, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela  pour faire le commerce de l’arachide, de poissons  et avec la présidente Aminata pour le commerce de condiments. Elle est  la première à droite et a sous ses pieds une assiette pleine de condiments.   
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe et le prêt précédent a été remboursé correctement. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt Aminata compte acheter, 1 carton de cube Maggi, 1 panier de tomates fraîches et 20 Kg d’oignons. 
Elle s’approvisionne au marché de BOUGOUNI  auprès des grossistes  et effectue sa vente de façon ambulante dans le quartier en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 25.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera utilisée pour rembourser le prêt, contribuer aux dépenses de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans l’entreprise.
texts.en: The BARA group is made up of four married women, who are on average 24 years old and who have on average 2 children. They live in traditional families in Massablacoura, one of the neighborhoods in the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the republic of Mali). They are neighbors. In an attempt to satisfy their clientele and to grow their business, they decided to incorporate microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in their businesses of selling peanuts and fish, and with their president, Aminata, who sells seasoning. She is the first one on the right, and next to her feet, there is a dish full of seasonings. They are on their second group loan and the previous loan was repaid. With this new loan, Aminata plans to buy 1 box of Maggi cubes (soup flavoring), 1 basket of fresh tomatoes, and 20 kg. of onions. She stocks up at the Bougouni market with wholesalers and sells door to door in the neighborhood for cash or credit to a clientele composed of men and women. With this loan, she plans to earn 25,000 FCFA monthly, of which part will be used to repay the loan and pay for family expenses, and the rest will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy seasonings

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est un regroupement quatre femmes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 4 enfants et vivant dans des familles nucléaires. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Massablacoura à BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de l’activité et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et augmenter le niveau de leur activité, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela pour faire le commerce de condiments, de céréales  et avec ROKIA  faire de la restauration, elle est la présidente du groupe et la deuxième à droite avec son foulard jaune. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt de groupe et les tous prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt ROKIA, compte acheter 100kg de riz et des condiments alimentaires pour des fins de restauration. Elle s’approvisionne à BOUGOUNI et vend ses mets alimentaires  au placer de Kola et à Massabla Coura, à domicile en détail, au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera utilisée pour rembourser le prêt et le reste sera  réinvesti dans  les dépenses.
texts.en:
BENKADI is a group of four married women, who are on average 36 years old with four kids, and live in nuclear families. These women live in the Massablacoura neighborhood of Bougouni (in Mali's third administrative region). They got to know each other through business and neighborhood relations.
In order to satisfy their customers and to increase their activity level, they have decided to join micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso, with the objective to trade in condiments and cereals, and in Rokia's case, to offer prepared foods. She is the group's president and the second woman from the right, with a yellow scarf.
They are on their eighth group loan; all previous loans have been repaid without difficulty.
With this new loan, Rokia plans on purchasing 100 kilos of rice and some condiments for caterers. She gets her supplies in Bougouni and sells her food on the marketplace in Kola and in Massabla Coura; she also retails from home and accepts cash. Her clientele is composed of men and women.
With this loan, she is counting on a monthly benefit of 40,000 FCFA, a part of which will be used to repay the loan, with the remainder to be reinvested in her expenses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for catering.

loans.name: Fazila

texts.ru:
Фазила трудолюбивая, умная и добросовестная девушка. Она занимается откармливанием скота дома вместе с братом. Когда её брат ездит за покупками скота, в это время она ухаживает и откармливает скота. Она откармливает их в течение 20 дней, а потом продает на выгодную цену на базар. Фазила хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свой прибыль для того, чтобы улучшить свое жилищное условие. Она запрашивает займ в размере 1000$ США для покупки скота. Она заранее благодарит всех кредиторов за поддержку и поощрение.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Fazila is a hard-working, smart and conscientious young woman.  Together with her brother, she is involved in fattening up livestock.  She looks after and feeds livestock, when her brother leaves to buy livestock.  She fattens up livestock for 20 days and then sells it at a profitable price at the market.  Fazila wants to expand her business and maximize her profit in order to improve her living conditions.  She is requesting a loan in the sum of $1000 for the purchase of livestock.  She thanks all creditors in advance for the support and help.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Nouhoum

texts.fr:
Monsieur Nouhoum est un homme marié de 51 ans et père de 3 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants chez son oncle dans une famille traditionnelle élargie, à Bougouni, dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord.
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école moderne, dès son jeune âge il commença les activités génératrices de revenus.
Durant des années, il mena les activités d’achat et de vente de poissons, mais cette activité ne lui a véritablement pas souri. C’est ainsi que depuis 3 ans il décida de changer d’activité pour mener les activités d’achat et de vente de boeufs. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son ami.
Ayant fait la connaissance de Soro Yiriwaso à travers sa femme qui est une cliente de l’institution, il décida de prendre lui aussi un prêt pour acheter quelques quatre à cinq boeufs. Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et dans les villages environnants. Il effectue sa vente au marché à bétail de Bougouni et une partie à Bamako, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de bouchers.
Monsieur Nouhoum compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000 FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice il envisage construire une maison  à usage d’habitation et agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en: Mr. Nouhoum is a 51-year-old married father of three. He lives with his wife and children at his uncle’s home in an enlarged traditional family in Bougouni, in the Hérémakono Nord neighborhood. Having not attended modern school, he has been working for a living since he was young. For years, he has been buying and selling fish, but this business has never truly appealed to him. This is why three years ago, he decided to change his business to buy and sell oxen. He learned how to conduct this business from a friend. Having been introduced to Soro Yiriwaso by his wife, who is one of their clients, he decided to take a loan to buy four or five oxen. He stocks up in Bougouni and neighboring villages. He sells at the cattle market in Bougouni and a part of Bamako to a clientele primarily composed of butchers. Mr. Nouhoum plans to earn 75,000 FCFA monthly. With his profit, he envisions building a house to live in and to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy oxen

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy bags and clothes

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI I  est un regroupe  de 9 femmes mariées du village de SANGOULA  de la sous préfecture de BLA, dans l’ex Cercle de BLA, région de SÉGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 44 ans, 4 enfants et cultivent  du riz, de l’arachide et du gombo. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles et d’augmenter les parcelles cultivables pour une meilleure production, les membres du groupe BENKADI I ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, sont à leur premier prêt de campagne. 
ROKIA,  la première assise à gauche, avec une écharpe rouge,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des semences de bonne qualité, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles pour la culture, exclusivement  au grand marché de BLA ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de BLA , YANGASSO et dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI I comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 40.000 à 46.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en: BENKADI I is a group of 9 married women from the Sangoula village in the prefecture of Bla, in the ex Cercle de BLA, region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali). They live in traditional families, are on average 44 years old, have on average 4 children, and cultivate rice, peanuts and okra. In an effort to make a profit with their farm and to increase their farmable land for better returns, the members of the BENKADI I group decided to incorporate the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first loan. Rokia, the first woman seated on the left with a red scarf, plans to use her loan to buy quality seeds, small equipment, and agricultural resources for farming, exclusively at the grand market of BLA city. After the winter, the harvest are stocked for a certain time for them to get some value before being sold at the grand market in BLA, YANGASSO and neighboring markets, by retail (often at wholesale), by credit to a clientele that generally come from big cities. After the yield of their agricultural products, the members of the BENKADI I group plan to each earn 40,000 – 46,000 FCFA monthly, which will be used to repay the loan’s interest and family expenses.

loans.use: to buy resources, seeds, and small equipment

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 40 years old, widowed, and is a mother of  three children aged 27, 16 and 10.  She has been running her restaurant for the past 28 years and makes a monthly profit of KES 15,000.  She has been loaned KES 25,000 to purchase cereals, vegetables, cooking oil, charcoal, etc. for her business. With the anticipated profit made, she hopes to reinvest back in the business.  She hopes to own a big hotel in the future.

loans.use: buy foof supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela was born in 1971.  She is married and is blessed with one child.  She runs a boutique to earn a living.  She also does tailoring to earn more income for her family. She has been in the business for four years.  Through Faulu Kenya, Pamela has expanded her business, which has generated good income for her family.  Her desire is to open other outlets for her business in five years. She needs a loan of 70,000 Kenyan shillings to buy shirts and trousers.

loans.use: To buy shirts and trousers

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 39 years old,  He is married to Rebecca, who is a teacher. They are blessed with three children.  He has been in a quarry business for the past three years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family members.

Robert is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous loan. He will use part of this loan to employ labor and the rest as working capital to increase his income.

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children up to university level. His hopes and dreams are to open a butcher shop, which will improve the living standards for his family.

loans.use: To employ labor and use as working capital

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI III  est un groupe  de femmes mariées du village de SANGOULA  de la sous préfecture de BLA, préfecture de BLA région de SÉGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans, 6 enfants et cultivent  du riz de l’arachide et du gombo. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles et d’augmenter les parcelles cultivables pour une meilleure production les membres du groupe BENKADI  III  ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année elles sont à leur premier prêt de campagne. 
RAMATOU A., debout au milieu avec une écharpe bleue,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des semences de bonne qualité, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles pour la culture, au grand marché de BLA. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de BLA ,YANGASSO et dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI III comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice moyen de 45.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
BENKADI III is a group of married women who come from the village of Sangoula, located in the sub-prefecture of Bla, an administrative subdivision of the Ségou Region (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women live in traditional households. They have an average age of 43, 6 children to raise and they grow rice, groundnuts and okra. In order to make their farms profitable and increase the amount of cultivatable land and therefore production, the members of the BENKADI III group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program and this year are requesting their first farming loan.
Ramatou A., standing in the middle of the picture and wearing the blue scarf, will use the loan to buy good quality seeds, small equipment and farm inputs (e.g. fertilizer, pesticide) at the Grand Market in Bla. After the rainy season, the harvested produce will be stored for a certain period of time so that it can gain in value before being sold at the markets of Bla, Yangasso and surrounding towns. It is often sold in bulk and mostly for cash to customers from large towns.
The members of the BENKADI III group are hoping to realize an average profit of 45 000 francs each after selling their produce, and will use those profits to pay off their loan interest and cover their household expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, seeds and small equipment.

loans.name: Zamira's Group

texts.en:
Zamira is the leader of this group. She is 28 and is married to a security guard. Together with her husband she brings up three sons. 

Zamira works as a teacher at a school.  In order to earn additional money for her family she runs her own business. Three years ago, with an initial investment of 500 soms she started a business retailing silver products.  At the moment, her business is running well and she earns about 5000 soms per month. 

Zamira applied for this loan because she needs funds to purchase more silver products in order to expand her business. In the future, Zamira wants to see her sons get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase silver products

loans.name: Benkadi Iv Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI IV  est constitué  de 10 femmes mariées du village de SANGOULA  de la sous préfecture de BLA, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 38 ans, au moins 4 enfants et cultivent  du riz de l’arachide et du gombo. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles et d’augmenter les parcelles cultivables pour une meilleure production les membres du groupe BENKADI  IV  ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année elles sont a leur premier prêt de campagne. 
MAISSATA, la première assise à droite avec  T-shirt   bleu,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des semences de bonne qualité, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles pour la culture, exclusivement  au grand marché de BLA. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de BLA  ,YANGASSO et dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail, au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes et qui sont essentiellement des revendeurs.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI IV comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice moyen de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The group Benkadi IV consists of 10 married women from the village of Sangoulé of the sub prefecture of BLA, region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families, are in average of 38 years of age, have at least four children and grow rice, groundnuts and okra. 
In order to make their farms more profitable and increase the arable plots for a better production, the group members of Benkadi IV have decided this year to integrate the credit program Soro Yiriwaso and they had their first loan campaign. 
Maissata, the first below on the right with blue T-shirt, plans to use her loan to buy seeds of good quality, small equipment and agricultural inputs, exclusively from the general market in Bla. After the rainy season, crops are stored for a while for them to increase their value before being sold at the general market of Bla, Yangasso and surrounding markets as well as in detail and cash, usually to customers coming from the major cities and who are mainly resellers. 
The members of the group Benkadi IV, after the sale of their agricultural products, plan to make an average profit of 30 000Fcfa each, to be used to pay back the loan interests and the current expenses of their families.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs, seeds and small equipment.

loans.name: Benkadi  V Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI V  est un groupe composé  de sept femmes mariées du village de SANGOULA  de la sous préfecture de BLA, préfecture de BLA région de SÉGOU. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 42 ans, 5 enfants et cultivent  du riz de l’arachide et du gombo. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles et d’augmenter les parcelles cultivables pour une meilleure production les membres du groupe BENKADI  V  ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année et sont à leur premier prêt de campagne. 
DJENEBA NAFORI, qui la présidente du groupe, est la deuxième debout à gauche, portant un complet brodé verdâtre et un foulard blanc,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des semences de bonne qualité, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles pour la culture, au grand marché de BLA auprès des revendeurs. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de BLA , de YANGASSO et dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail, en gros, au comptant, à une clientèle constituée de consommateurs et de revendeurs.
DJENEBA NAFORI, compte réaliser  après l’écoulement de ses produits agricoles, un bénéfice de  45.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et aider le mari dans les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
BENKADI V is a group made up of seven married women from Sangoula, a village in the sub-prefecture of Bla, in the Bla prefecture, region of Segou. They live in traditional families, are on average 42 years old with 5 children, and grow groundnuts and gumbo.
In the interests of securing a return on their farms to increase the size of their farmable plots of land for an improved production, this year the members of the BENKADI V group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit programme and this is their first rural loan.
DJENEBA NAFORI is the president of the group, she is the second from the left standing up, and wearing a greenish embroidered suit and a white headscarf. She plans to use her loan to buy good quality seeds, small tools, and fertilisers for cultivation from the stockists at the big market in Bla. After wintering, the crops are stocked for a certain period of time so that they appreciate in value. They are then sold at the big market in BLA, YANGASSO, and in the neighbouring markets, for cash, retail  or wholesale to a clientele made up of consumers and retailers.
DJENEBA NAFORI hopes to make a profit of 45.000FCFA after the sale of her agricultural products which will be used for the payment of the interests of the loan and for helping her husband to pay the family expenses.

loans.use: Purchase farming inputs,seeds and small tools.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 27 years old, married and has two children who are in school.  She does tailoring to earn a living for her family.  She mainly makes bed covers and cushion covers. In addition, she sells hair braids and hair clips in the same business premise.

Through Faulu Kenya, Julia has been trained on business management skills. This has helped her to improve her business.  She has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy fabric and a sewing machine, and to install electricity in her business premise.

loans.use: To buy fabric,  sewing machine and install electricity

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en: Josphat is a business man.  He is 22 years old and single. He has been managing a business selling shoes to make a living. In the next 5 years, he wants to become successful in his business. His dream is to expand his business into wholesale.  Josphat is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan  shillings to buy leather materials for shoe making. He is thankful to Faulu Kenya for helping him to improve his business through financial support.

loans.use: To buy leather material for shoe making

loans.name: Zaur

texts.ru:
Zaur jenat i imeyet odnogo rebonka. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Zaur 33 qoda.
 On uje 7 let kak rabotayet taxistom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya pochinki svoyego taxi.
texts.en: Zaur is married and has one child.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Baku region together with his family.  Zaur is 33 years.  He has been working as a taxi driver for seven years.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy auto parts and repair his taxi.

loans.use: to buy auto parts

loans.name: Djeyesse Ii Group

texts.fr:
DJEYESSE  II est un groupe de 10 femmes mariées du village de KOLA SANGOULA, qui  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 47 ans, 5 enfants et cultivent généralement du riz, de l’arachide et du gombo. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles et d’augmenter les parcelles cultivables pour une meilleure production les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année et sont à leur premier prêt de campagne. 
BINTOU MADOU, la deuxième assise à droite avec  foulard jaune, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des semences de bonne qualité, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles, au grand marché de BLA. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de BLA , YANGASSO et dans les marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 20.000à 40.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
DJEYESSE is a group of 10 married women from the Kolga Sangoula village. They all live in traditional families, are 47 years old with 5 children; they grow rice, peanuts and okra for a living. In order to drive profits and to boost the productivity of their land, the group members are seeking their first loan from Soro Yiriwaso. 
Bintou Madou is the second lady sitting on the right with the yellow headscarf. She aims to use her loan to purchase good quality seeds, small tools and fertilisers from BLA's large market. After winter, the harvests are stored for a certain amount of time so that they accumulate in value before being sold in the large BLA market, in Yangasso and in the surrounding markets. She sells at wholesale and retail, and takes cash from a customer base predominantly from large towns. 
The members of the group aim to generate 20,000 to 40,000 FCFA each, which will be used to repay the interest on the loan and to see to their families' everyday needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilisers, seeds and small tools

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a businessman aged 45 years old. He is married and blessed with seven children. He recycles scrap metal to make jikos (energy-saving cookers), water cans and pans. He expanded his business premise with his previous loan from Faulu Kenya and consequently generated more income.  Through Faulu Kenya, he also managed to start dairy farming, which generates extra income for his family. He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy scrap metal.

loans.use: To buy scrap metal

loans.name: Djeyesse Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 femmes qui constituent le groupe DJEYESSE III sont toutes mariées dans  le village de KOLA SANGOULA,  de la sous préfecture de BLA,  dans l’ex Cercle de BLA , région de SÉGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et au moins 4 enfants. Elles cultivent  du riz de l’arachide et du gombo. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles et d’augmenter les parcelles cultivables pour une meilleure production les membres du groupe DJEYESSE III  ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année et sont à leur premier prêt de campagne. 
FANTA G., assise au milieu avec un foulard noir au coud ,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des semences de bonne qualité, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles pour la culture, exclusivement  au grand marché de BLA ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de BLA ,YANGASSO et dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 20500 à 45.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 women who make up the DJEYESSE III group are all married and live in the village of Kola Sangoula,Bla sub-prefecture, in the ex-circle of Bla, Segou region (the fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali) They live in traditional families. They are on average 42 years old and have at least 4 children. They grow rice, groundnuts, and gumbo.
In order to ensure a return on their farms and increase their farmable plots of land for a better yield, this year the members of the DJEYESSE III   group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit programme and this is their first loan.
FANTA G, who is sitting in the middle with a black scarf on her elbow, intends to use her loan to purchase good quality seeds, small tools, and agricultural products for cultivation, exclusively at the big market in the town of Bla. After wintering, the harvest is stored for a certain period of time so that it appreciates in value. It is then sold at the markets in Bla, Yangasso, and the neighbouring towns, retail, (often wholesale), for cash to customers who generally come from the big towns.
The members of the group intend to make a profit after the sale of their products of between 20.500 and 45.000FCFA which will be used for the repayment of the interests of their loan and the family expenditure.

loans.use: Purchase farming products,seeds and small tools.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Alexander is a businessman who is 31 years old. He is married and blessed with three children. For the last five years, he has been selling oil. He earns extra income from his retail shop. He has employed five people to help him to operate the business. For the next five years, he wants to add more employees in his business.  He is requesting a loan of 19,995 Kenyan shilling to buy oil. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, it has enabled him to improve his business and his living standards.

loans.use: To buy oil

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 35-year-old businessman married to Joyce who is a farmer. He has been employed as the primary income earner and owns a retail shop as the secondary business for the past six years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Francis will use the loan to buy sugar, rice and cooking fat to sell. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hope and dream is to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and cooking fat for his shop

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene is 24 years old and single. She has been running a retail shop for the past three years, with a monthly income of KES 5,500, which she uses to support her siblings and parents. 

She is applying for her sixth loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Magdalene will use the loan to buy sugar, rice, wheat flour and maize meal to add to her shop to sell.

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will expand her shop. Her hope and dream is to open a wholesale shop, which will cater to her basic needs and those of her siblings.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, wheat flour and maize meal to add to her shop

loans.name: Felister

texts.en: Felister is a hardworking businesswoman aged 61. She is married and blessed with nine children. For the last 12 years, she has been operating a business selling water to make a living. She also raises pigs for more income. She has employed three people to help her to operate the business. In the next five years, she wants to add more tanks. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy water tanks.

loans.use: To buy tanks of water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add sugar, rice, wheat flour and cooking fat to sell

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is a 50-year-old mixed crop farmer married to Ruth who is also a farmer. They are blessed with two children. He has been practicing mixed crop farming for the past 20 years with a monthly income of KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Stanley will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will venture into dairy farming. His hopes and dreams are to have a greenhouse, which will increase his income and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Djeyesse Iv Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de 10 membres, DJEYESSE IV  est un regroupe de femmes toutes mariées du village de KOLA SANGOULA  de la sous préfecture de BLA,  région de SÉGOU, qui  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans, 4 enfants et cultivent  du riz de l’arachide et du gombo. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles et d’augmenter les parcelles cultivables pour une meilleure production les membres du groupe DJEYESSE IV  ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année elles sont à leur premier prêt de campagne. 
KADIATOU S.,  debout au milieu,   compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des semences de bonne qualité, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles pour la culture,au grand marché de BLA. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de BLA ,YANGASSO et dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 20.000 à 45.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Djeyesse IV is a group constituted of ten members, all married women living in traditional families in the village of Kola Sangoula in Bla sub-prefecture, Segou region. They are on average 38 years old with four kids, and cultivate groundnuts and okra.
In order to make their farms more profitable and to increase cultivable areas for better production, the members of group Djeyesse IV have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso’s lending program this year; they are on their first agricultural loan.
Kadiatou S., who is standing in the middle, plans on using her loan to buy quality seeds, small equipment and agricultural cultivation intrants from the great market in Bla. After the rainy season, the harvest is stored for a while to increase in value before being sold wholesale for cash (sometimes retailed) at the great markets in Bla, Yangasso and neighboring towns, to a clientele generally coming from the larger cities.
After selling their crops, the group’s members are counting on an individual profit of 20,000 to 45,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay the loan’s interests and for the day-to-day expenses of their families.

loans.use: to buy agricultural fertilizers, seeds and small equipment.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 30-year-old enterprising businessman who is married to Catherine. He has been running a barber shop as the primary business and farming as the secondary business for the past five years, with a monthly income of KES 7,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his third loan from KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. James will use the loan to buy a shaving machine and seedlings for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the two businesses, he will expand the barber shop.

His hopes are to open a big barber shop and a salon, which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy a shaving machine for the barber shop and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 35-year-old quarry businessman. He is married to Agnes who is employed. They are blessed with five children. He has been in the quarry business for the past two years, with a monthly income of KES 6,000, which he uses to support his wife’s income.

He is applying for his second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. John will use the loan to employ labor in his business to increase his stock. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. 

His hopes are to buy a pick-up for transporting the stones and to educate his children up to the university level.

loans.use: To pay for labor in his quarry business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy necklaces, bangles and earrings to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase feed for his cattle and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Mais

texts.ru:
Mais 43 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 4 detey. Mais yavlyayetsya IDP personom, on pereselenec iz Fuzuli gorod, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione posolke Kayidish specialno postroyenniy dlya vinujdennix pereselencev. Mais uje 10 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov.
Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Maisa , on blagopoluchno oplatil pervuyu ssudu i za etu ssudu on blagodaren Kive i lenderam.
Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korov dlya razvitiya skotovodstva.

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/126666
texts.en: Mais is 43 years old, married and has four children.  Mais is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person), who moved from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Kayidish village of the Fuzuli region.  This village was built specifically for displaced people.  Mais has been involved in animal husbandry for 10 years and breeds cattle.  This is his second loan.  He successfully repaid his first loan and is grateful to Kiva and lenders for this loan.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy cattle and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Abdoulaye a plus de 42 ans, marié et père de cinq enfants, il réside avec son épouse et leurs enfants à Sikasso.
Monsieur  Abdoulaye  est un mécanicien de profession qui travaille au garage de Compagnie Malienne de Développement Textile (C.M.D.T.) de Sikasso, en plus de cette fonction, il mène  des activités d'embouche et  de commercialisation de bétails et de l’aviculture, il y a environ huit années, dans la ville de Sikasso. 
Dans le souci de mieux améliorer ses activités d'embouche, afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y'a de cela quatre ans. Après 3 prêts individuels tous correctement remboursés, il  sollicite son quatrième prêt pour d’aménager son enclos d'embouche et acheter 5 bovins maigres. Il achète ses bétails dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso : Lobougoula, Kadiolo, Bougouni et Kolondièba. Monsieur Abdoulaye, qui nourrit et engraisse ses animaux avant la vente dans les différents marchés à bétails tels Bobo Dioulasso (au Burkina Faso), Ouangolo (en Côte d'Ivoire)et quelque fois à Sikasso ville, gagne beaucoup en  produits laitiers grâce à ses vaches de meilleure qualité. Sa clientèle est composée essentiellement de bouchers et de revendeurs.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 350.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye is over 42 years old, married and a father of five. He lives with his wife and their children in Sikasso.
Mr. Abdoulaye is a car mechanic by trade, who works at the car repair shop of the Compagnie Malienne de Développement Textile (Malian Company for Textile Development) in Sikasso. In addition to his job, he has had a business fattening and selling cattle and poultry for about eight years.
In order to improve his operation and to meet ever-growing customer demand, he decided to join micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso four years ago. After three loans, which all were repaid timely, he is requesting his fourth loan to increase his working capital and equip the enclosure in which the cattle is fattened, as well as to buy five lean oxes. He purchases his cattle in Sikasso's neighboring towns (Lobougoula, Kadiolo, Bougouni, etc.). Mr. Abdoulaye, who feeds and fattens his cattle before the sale, increases his dairy yield thanks to higher-quality cows.
With this loan, he is planning on making a monthly profit of 350,000 FCFA. This will mainly be used to increase his working capital, contribute to the family's expenses and repay his loan's interests.

loans.use: to buy oxes.

loans.name: Kalima's Group

texts.en:
Kalima, 41, is the leader of this group. Together with her husband, who works in a ferro-concrete factory, she brings up a daughter and a son. Their daughter is in school but their son doesn't yet attend as he is pre-school age (under seven). Kalima works in a textile factory. Two years ago, she saved 10,000 soms and, with that money, she and her husband started to breed livestock. Kalima applied for this loan as she needs additional money to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future, she dreams to purchase a big house for her family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for breeding.

loans.name: Ummy

texts.en: Ummy, 39, is a hard-working business woman. She is married and blessed with three children. For the past 10 years, she has managed a salon business to make a living. She has employed four people to help her in her business. In the next five years, she wants to open a new salon. She is requesting for a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a hair drier. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a hair drier for her salon.

loans.name: Linnet

texts.en:
Linnet, 38, is married to Wycliffe, who is employed, and they are blessed with three children. She has been selling charcoal for the past year, earning a monthly income of 5,500 KES which she uses to support her family.

Linnet is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd after being introduced by a KADET staff member. She will use the loan to buy sacks of charcoal to increase her income.

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. She hopes to open a hotel which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to increase her income.

loans.name: Assetou

texts.fr:
Née  à Sikasso et âgée aujourd’hui de 33 ans, Assetou  est mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont 3 garçons et 1 fille, elle réside avec son époux et leurs enfants aux logements sociaux ATTBOUGOU de Sikasso, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame  Assetou n’ayant pas la chance d’avancer dans les études, elle  s’est très vite initiée aux activités de commerce d’articles divers dont elle dispose une boutique devant le domicile conjugal où elle mène ses activités d’achat et de vente  de Cigarettes, bonbons, allumettes, Chewing-gum, lait en poudre, thé, sucre, etc il y a environ douze ans. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a quelque mois. Ainsi, elle est à son un premier qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
 Elle compte acheter avec ce premier prêt,  2 cartouches de Cigarettes différentes, 5 paquets de Chewing-gum, 2 cartons de lait en poudre (en sachets), 5 gros paquets du thé, 1 sac du sucre, 10 paquets de bonbons, 20 paquets d’allumettes et quelques alvéoles d’œufs . Elle achète ses marchandises chez les commerçants grossistes de place avant de les revendre en détail au comptant  et à crédit à une clientèle composée de voisins et surtout des jeunes..
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce premier crédit un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born in Sikasso and now 33 years old, Assetou is married and a mother of four, three boys and a girl. She lives with her husband and their children in the Attbougou public housing of Sikasso, in one of the popular district of Sikasso (located in Mali's third administrative region).
Since Mrs. Assetou did not have the opportunity to advance in her studies, she very rapidly familiarized herself with the trade of various items and has had for about twelve years a shop in the front of her house. There she buys and sells cigarettes, candy, matches, chewing-gum, powdered milk, tea, sugar, etc. She is very much in demand thanks to the quality of her products.
To meet demand from a growing number of customers, she decided to join micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso a few months ago. She thus is on her first loan, which will allow her to increase her working capital in order to better satisfy her customers.
With this first loan, she is planning on buying two cartons of cigarettes from different brands, five cartons of chewing-gum, two cartons of powdered milk (in pouches), five large packs of tea, one bag of sugar, ten cartons of candy, twenty packs of matches and a few egg cartons. She purchases her merchandise form local wholesalers before retailing it for cash or credit to a clientele composed of neighbors, and mostly of young people.
With this first loan, she is planning on a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA, which will mainly be used to contribute to the expenses of the family and to pay her loan's interests, with the remainder to be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous grocery items.

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr:
Né vers 1970 à Nimporodioula préfecture de Sikasso, Monsieur Issa est polygame avec 4 épouses et est père de six enfants. Il réside avec ses quatre femmes et leurs enfants dans sa propre maison à Médine, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrtive de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès notamment l’agriculture et autres, il s’est vite initié aux activités de stockage et commercialisation de produits alimentaires tels le poids sucré, les noix de karité et les céréales depuis plus de 10 années. Avec une telle expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et reçoit beaucoup de commandes de l’extérieur, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins font défaut. Ainsi, il intégra Soro Yiriwaso il y a quatre années  et a bénéficié quatre prêts qui ont été  tous correctement remboursés. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il sollicite  ce cinquième prêt qui lui permettra d’acheter 15 sacs de pois sucré, 3 tonnes de maïs, 7 sacs de mil et 8 sacs de noix de karité. 
Il s’approvisionne dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso pour ensuite les stocker dans son magasin sis au nouveau du marché de  Médine Sikasso, en fin de les ramener à Abidjan et à Bobo Dioulasso (respectivement les république de Côte d’Ivoire et Burkina Faso) sur commande des usines de fabrique de jus de pois sucré et de beure de karité. Pour les céréales, elles sont vendues sur place à la fois en gros et en détail, aux revendeurs essentiellement.    
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA. Avec le bénéfice réalisé, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born around 1970 in the Nimporodioula prefecture of Sikasso, Mr. Issa is polygamous with four wives and six children. He lives with his wives and their children in his own house in Medine, one of the popular districts in the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
After unsuccessfully trying his hand at several businesses, including agriculture, he rapidly learned the business of stocking and retailing food products such as tiger nuts, Shea nuts, and cereals, in which he started ten years ago. With such an experience in this domain, he enjoys a strong reputation and gets many orders from the outside, but he is lacking the resources to meet the demand. He therefore joined Soro Yiriwaso four years ago, and has benefited from four loans, which were all timely repaid.
In order to better meet his ever-growing customer demand, he is requesting this fifth loan. It will enable him to purchase 15 bags of tiger nuts, three tons of corn, seven bags of millet and eight bags of Shea nuts. He gets his supplies from the towns around Sikasso and then stocks them in his store located in the new Medine market of Sikasso, before transferring them to Abidjan and Bobo Dioulasso (respectively in the Republics of Ivory Coast and Burkina Faso) when he gets orders from manufacturers of tiger nut juice and Shea butter. As for cereals, they are sold locally, both wholesale and retail, but mostly to retailers.
With this loan, he is planning on a monthly benefit of 300,000 FCFA. With the profit, he means to address his main expenditure, his family's expenses, to pay his loan's interests and to reinvest the remainder in his business.

loans.use: to purchase food products.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a hard-working business man. He is married and blessed with three children. He repairs electronics, particularly radios and televisions, to earn a living. He has been engaged in this business for 13 years. In the next five years, Joseph wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy spare parts for televisions and radios. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Malik

texts.fr:
Monsieur Malik âgé de 37 ans marié et père de quatre  enfants, il habite avec sa famille à Sanoubougou I- Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali) .
Il excelle dans l’activité de Prêt à Porter depuis 14 ans, et cela après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès. Vu l’augmentation de sa clientèle et que ses ressources propres ne pouvant satisfaire les attentes de cette clientèle, il  jugea utile de venir auprès de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour lui solliciter un premier prêt individuel, qui fut correctement remboursé. Ainsi il demande ce deuxième prêt pour acheter, 15 chemises différentes, 17 pantalons de qualité différentes, 15 paires de chaussure différentes (Soulier, Ferardine, etc.), 5 complets de veste, 10 Tee-Shirt, 5 complets de sous-vêtement, etc.
   Il s’approvisionne à Bamako pour venir  revendre dans sa boutique sise en plein cœur de la gare routière de Sikasso avec une clientèle composée essentiellement des voyageurs et transporteurs.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce crédit un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 140 000 FCFA qui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce mais également d’honorer ses engagements à l’égard de Soro Yiriwaso et couvrir d’autres dépenses familles.
texts.en:
Mr Malik is 37 years old, married and a father of four. He lives with his family in Sanoubougou I - Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
He has been excelling in the ready-to-wear business for 14 years, this after unsuccessfully trying out several businesses. Given the increase in his clientele and the insufficiency of his personal resources to satisfy his customers' expectations, he assessed that joining micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso would be useful, and requested a first individual loan, which was repaid timely. Similarly, he is requesting this second loan to purchase 15 different shirts, 17 pairs of trousers of various qualities, 15 different pairs of shoes (brands such as Soulier, Ferardine, etc.), five suits, ten tee-shirts, five sets of underwear, etc.
He gets his supplies from Bamako to retail in his shop located at the heart of the bus station in Sikasso, with a clientele mostly comprising travelers and carriers.
With this loan, he is planning on an average monthly profit of 140,000 FCFA, which will allow him to increase his working capital, and also to honor his commitment to Soro Yiriwaso and pay for other family expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a member of Faith group under Faulu Kenya. She operates a cafeteria to earn a living and employs eight people in her business. She previously operated a retail shop to earn a living for her family. Josephine has been operating her business since 1998 and has experienced a lot of growth. She has requested a loan of 100,000 KES to buy ingredients such as meat, maize flour and rice.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, maize flour and rice.

loans.name: Sakia

texts.en:
Sakia, a hardworking 26-year-old businesswoman, is married and blessed with one child. For the last two years, she has been operating a retail shop to make a living, and within the next five years, she wants to transform it into a wholesale operation. Her dream is to buy a piece of land.

Sakia is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy a weighing machine, cooking fat, maize flour, and sugar. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a weighing machine, cooking fat, maize flour, and sugar.
