loans.name: Mohamedi

texts.fr:
Né à Sikasso ville et âgé de 23 ans, Monsieur Mohamedi est un célibataire sans enfant résidant dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Kaboïla II- Sikasso (troisième région administrtive de la république du Mali).
 N’ayant pas la chance d’avancer dans les études, il s’est initié il y a dix ans à cette activité d’achat-vente de fruits et légumes et de tubercules : pomme de terre, orange, citron, patate, melon, bananes, ignames mangues, etc. Avec une telle expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et accueille beaucoup de commandes au niveau de Bamako, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins fait défaut. Ainsi, il intégra Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son premier prêt qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour en fin répondre aux attentes de ses clients. Ainsi ce premier prêt il achètera dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso, 10 sacs de pomme de terre, 10 sacs d’orange, 15 sacs de citron et 20 sacs de patates douces. Ses ventes sont faites en gros et en détail, au comptant et crédit à une clientèle composée de toutes les couches sociales mais surtout aux  restaurateurs.  
Avec ce premier crédit, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Born in Sikasso and 23 years of age, Mr. Mohamedi is single without children. He lives in a large extended family in Kaboïla II- Sikasso (the third administrative district of Mali). Not having had a chance to go on with his studies, ten years ago he launched a business buying and reselling fruits, vegetables and tubers: potatoes, oranges, lemons, sweet potatoes, melons, bananas, yams, mangoes etc. With his long experience, he enjoys a good business reputation in Bamako and receives many orders, but lacks the necessary resources to meet demand. And so he joined Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his first loan, which will allow him to increase his working capital in order to meet the customers’ expectations. This first loan will allow him to buy  10 bags of oranges, 15 bags of lemons and 20 bags of sweet potatoes  from villages around Sikasso. He sells wholesale and retail, for cash and on credit, to customers coming from all social segments but mostly to restaurant owners. With this first loan, he plans to achieve a monthly income of 100,000 West African Francs, which will be used to cover the essential expenses for himself and his relatives and to pay off the interest on his loan, with the rest reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables and tubers

loans.name: Yacouba

texts.fr:
Né à Sikasso et âgé de 34 ans, Monsieur  Yacouba est marié et père de six enfants, il réside avec son épouse et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle Bougoula Hameau environ 7 km de la ville de Sikasso  (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Yacouba après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès,  s’est initié au commerce de céréales de d’articles divers de boutique, dont il dispose une boutique devant le domicile conjugal où il mène ses activités d’achat et vente des articles  tels,  le maïs, la cigarette, les bonbons, allumettes, Chewing Gum, lait en poudre, thé, sucre, savon, etc depuis plus de douze ans. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il ya environ quatre ans. Ainsi il déjà bénéficié de quatre prêts individuels qui ont été tous correctement remboursés. 
Il sollicite ce cinquième prêt pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acquérir 6 tonnes de maïs, 15 cartouches de Cigarettes différentes, 3 cartons du thé, 4 sacs du sucre, 8 paquets de lait en poudre, 5 paquets de bonbons, 10 paquets de Chewing Gum, 30 paquets d’allumettes et 5 cartons de savon. 
 S’approvisionnant auprès de commerçants grossistes de la ville de Sikasso et environnants, il revend ses marchandises en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de toutes sortes de couches sociales de sa localité.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born in Sikasso and 34 years of age, Mr. Yacouba is married and the father of six children. He lives with his spouse and   children in a big traditional family in the village of Bougoula, about 7 km from the city of Skiasso (the third administrative region of Mali).

After having tried different business activities without success, Mr. Yacoubal started selling cereals and various first-need items from a store in front of his family home.  For over a dozen years, he has been selling articles such as corn, cigarettes, candy, matches, chewing gum, milk powder, tea, sugar, soap., etc. He is much sought after by his customers due to the quality of his goods.

In order to meet the growing customer demand,   about four years ago he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution about four years ago. And  thus he already obtained four individual loans and repaid all of them well.

He is now seeking  his fifth loan in order to increase his working capital and buy six tons of corn, 15 cartions of various cigarettes, three boxes of tea, four bags of sugar, eight packs of milk powder, five packs of bandy, ten packs of chewing gum, 30 packs of matches and five boxes of soap.

He  buys his goods from wholesalers in the town of Sikasso and in nearby area and sells retail, for cash and on credit to customers coming from all social segments in his neighborhood.

With this loan, he plans to achieve a monthly income of 100,000 West African francs, which will be used to offset family expenses and pay the interest on his loan, with the rest reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals and various first-need items

loans.name: Asylkul's Group

texts.en:
Asylkul, the treasurer of this group, is 46 and married to a farmer. She and her husband have four daughters and a son. Their first daughter is married and lives separately with her family, while their son and second daughter are at school, and the other two daughters are twins of preschool age.(under seven).

In order to earn a livelihood, the family cultivates agricultural products and breeds livestock for eventual sale. With money received from the loan, Asylkul wants to purchase sheep for breeding. In the future she wants to provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Kadidia

texts.fr:
Madame Kadidia a plus de 30 ans, mariée, mère de deux fillettes et vivant avec son époux et leurs enfants à Sanoubougou I-Kapel Kourou, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Kadidia après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et vente des produits alimentaires et condiments tels , le thé Arawane, l’huile alimentaire, le couscous arabe, les boîtes de petits pois, de macédoines de légumes, les cubes Magie, les sels de cuisine, les boîtes de concentrées de tomate, les sachets de moutarde et divers autres condiments alimentaires depuis plus de six  années. Elle mène son activité à la maison et au marché de son quartier où elle dispose  d’une place. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant de trois ans. Elle est actuellement à son 5ème prêt  et tous les quatre précédents ont été bien remboursés.
 Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 10 bidons d’huile alimentaire, 5 cartons de couscous arabe, 12 cartons de maggie, 5 cartons du thé Arawane et de stock de condiments. Elle  achète ses marchandises sur commande à Bobo Dioulasso (république de Burkina Faso) et aussi dans les huileries de place avant de les revendre en détail, au comptant et à crédit au marché de sa localité.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 180 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kadidia is over thirty years old, married, and is the mother of two girls. She lives with her husband and their children in Sanoubougou I-Kapel Kourou, one of the suburbs of the city of Sikasso (the third administrate region of the Republic of Mali). 

After conducting many unsuccessful activities, Mrs. Kadidia entered into the business of buying and selling food products and seasonings such as Arawane tea, cooking oil, Arabian couscous, boxes of peas, vegetable salads, Magic Cubes [cubes of seasoning], cooking salts, boxes of tomato concentrate, bags of mustard, and various other food seasonings. She has been in business for over six years. She runs her business out of her home as well as from her space in her neighborhood market. She is much sought after by her customers because of the quality of her products. 

In order to satisfy her increasingly expanding clientele, she decided to collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and has been working with them for three years now. She is currently in her fifth loan cycle and has repaid all of her four past loans. With this loan, she plans to buy 10 drums of cooking oil, 5 cases of Arabian couscous, 12 cases of Maggie [Magic Cubes], 5 cases of Arawane tea, and to stock up on seasonings. She purchases her goods on order in Bobo Dioulasso (in the republic of Burkina Faso) and at nearby oil mills before reselling them at her local market as retail for cash or on credit. 

With this loan, she envisions achieving a monthly profit of 180,000 FCFA, which she will use primarily to supplement her business assets for her expenses, to contribute to her family's expenses, and to pay the interest on her loan.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Né à Sikasso et âgé de 26 ans, Monsieur Seydou est marié et père de trois  garçons, il réside avec sa femme et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie  à Banconi , un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Monsieur Seydou est un réparateur d’engin à deux roues de profession depuis maintenant plus de quinze ans. Afin de permettre à ses clients d’acquérir des pièces détachées d’origine de qualité, il mène parallèlement à son métier, l’achat-vente des motos d’occasion et leurs détachement en pièces. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il sollicite un premier prêt individuel.
Il compte acheter avec ce  premier  prêt,  trois moto d’occasion qui seront  détachées en pièces à savoir les bielles, arbres à came, pistons, jantes, façades, carcasse, fourches etc. Les marchandise (pièces) sont achetées sur places à travers le démontage des véhicules casses pour être vendues par pièces dans son magasin au sein de son garage.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 95 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Seydou was born in Sikasso. He is 26 years old, married, and the father of three sons. He lives with his wife and children in an extended traditional family in Banconi, a popular district of the city of Sikasso. 


Mr. Seydou has been a motorcycle repairman for over fifteen years. In order for his clients to have access to quality genuine spare parts, he also buys, sells, and dismantles used motorcycles. He is in high demand due to the quality of his merchandise. 


To satisfy the needs of a growing customer base, he joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now seeking his first individual loan. He plans to use this loan to purchase three used motorcycle to be dismantled into parts such as connecting rods, camshafts, pistons, rims, frame, forks, etc. 
Parts are also purchased locally from dismantled scrap vehicles to be sold in the shop he runs from his garage. 


With this loan, he plans to earn a monthly profit of 95,000 FCFA, which he will use primarily to increase his working capital, help with household expenses, and pay the interest on the loan. Any remainder will be reinvested in his business

loans.use: to buy used motorcycles

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe BENKADI 1 est composé de femmes toutes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à MAARO, un village situé à environ 45 km de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance  Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième cycle prêt avec l’institution. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le riz et l’arachide  avec Madame MICHATA debout au milieu.
Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et la semence d’arachide pour entretenir : 0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village à LOUTANA et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75 000 FCFA  en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The group Benkadi I is made up of  married women. They are on average 38 years old and have an average of 4 children each. For the most part they live in polygamous families in Maaro, a village located about 45 km from Sikasso, 3rd administrative district of Mali.

They are working with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. This is their fifth loan with Soro Yiriwaso. The previous loans were fully repaid. The crops they grow are rice and groundnuts. Madame Michata, standing in the center, plans to pay for plowing costs and to buy inputs and groundnut seeds for 0.5 hectare of land. After the harvest, the crops are sold at the village of Loutanna and at the Sikasso market to customers who are both men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 75,000 CFA francs at the end of the season. The profit will allow her to repay the loan and help her husband with everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy inputs and groundnut seeds and to pay for plowing costs.

loans.name: Benkadi  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à MAARO, un village situé à environ 45 km de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième cycle prêt avec l’institution. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le riz et l’arachide  avec Madame AWA assise au milieu.
Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labours, acheter des intrants et  de semences pour entretenir : 1,5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village de LOUTANA et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 110.000 FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains
texts.en:
The ten members of this group called  BENKADI 2 are married women with an average age of 36 and on average, five children, and mostly live in polygamous families in  MAARO, a village situated about 45 km from the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution. Their prior loans have been correctly reimbursed. 

The crops cultivated are rice and peanuts, in the case of Madame AWA, seated in the middle. With her loan she intends to pay for plowing and buy inputs and seeds to maintain 1.5 hectares. The produce is sold right in the village of  LOUTANA and at the market of SIKASSO after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 110,000 F CFA at the end of the growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses. 

She would like to continue this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso so as to be able to cultivate an even larger area so as to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, pay for plowing, and buy seeds.

loans.name: Aizat's Group

texts.en:
Aizat is the leader of this group. She is 27 and married to a constructor. Together with her husband, she is bringing up two children, both of whom are preschool age. Five years ago Aizat started to take orders and sew Kyrgyz national clothes, pillows and blankets. In this way she earns about 3000 soms per month. This profit made it possible for her to save money to build a summer kitchen. She applied for the loan because she needs additional funds to finish house repair. The loan purpose is the purchase of building materials. In the future Aizat wishes to purchase a vehicle for the family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase building materials.

loans.name: Benkadi  3 Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI 3 est un regroupement de membres qui des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à MAARO, un village situé à environ 45 km de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième cycle prêt avec l’institution et tous les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le riz et l’arachide  avec Madame SAFIATOU   premier debout à droite.
Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et la semence de riz  pour entretenir : 0,25 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village de LOUTANA et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20.000 FCFA  en fin de  campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains
texts.en:
BENKADI 3 regroups married women with an average age of 37 and on average, six children, who  live in polygamous families in MAARO, a village situated about 45 km from the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution. Their prior loans have been correctly reimbursed.

The crops cultivated are rice and peanuts, in the case of Madame SAFIATOU, standing first on the right. With her loan she intends to pay for plowing and buy inputs and rice seed to maintain 0.25 hectares. The produce is sold right in the village of LOUTANA and at the market of SIKASSO after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 20,000 F CFA at the end of the growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

She would like to continue this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso so as to be able to cultivate an even larger area so as to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy inputs, pay for plowing, and buy rice seed.

loans.name: Benkadi  4 Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe BENKADI  4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à MAARO, un village situé à environ 45 km de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième cycle prêt avec l’institution. Les prêts ante rieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le riz et l’arachide  avec Madame MAMOU              debout à l’extrème gauche avec la foulard rouge.
Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labours, acheter des intrants et des semences pour entretenir : 2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village de LOUTANA et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 160 000 FCFA  en fin de  campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The six members of the group called BENKADI 4 are married women with an average age of 32 and on average, three children, who  mostly live in polygamous families in MAARO, a village situated about 45 km from the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution. Their prior loans have been correctly reimbursed.

The crops cultivated are rice and peanuts, in the case of Madame MAMOU, standing on the far left with a red scarf. With her loan she intends to pay for plowing and buy inputs and seed to maintain 2 hectares. The produce is sold right in the village of LOUTANA and at the market of SIKASSO after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 160,000 F CFA at the end of the growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy inputs, pay for plowing, and purchase seed.

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de sept membres, les femmes du groupe BENKADI 5 sont toutes mariées  avec en moyenne 37 ans, 6 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à MAARO, un village situé à environ 45 km de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième cycle prêt avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée par FATOUMA deuxième debout à droite, enfant au dos, est  le riz et l’arachide.               
Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labours, acheter des intrants et des semences pour entretenir : 1,5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village de LOUTANA et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000 FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The group Benkadi 5 is made up of seven married women. They are on average 37 years old and have an average of 6 children each. For the most part they live in polygamous families in Maaro, a village located about 45 km from Sikasso, 3rd administrative district of Mali.

They are working with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. This is their fifth loan with Soro Yiriwaso. The previous loans were fully repaid. The crops grown by Fatouma, second from the right, standing, with a child on her back, are rice and groundnuts. With her loan, she plans to pay for plowing costs and to buy inputs and seeds for 1.5 hectares of land. After the harvest, the crops are sold at the village of Loutanna and at the Sikasso market to customers who are both men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 100,000 CFA francs at the end of the season. The profit will allow her to repay the loan and help her husband with everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Benkadi  A Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  femmes du groupe BENKADI  A  sont toutes mariées, ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, 6 enfants et vivent  toutes dans des  familles polygames à MAARO, un village situé à environ 45 km de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième cycle prêt avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  essentiellement: le riz et l’arachide  avec Madame ALIMATA debout au milieu.
Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labours, acheter des intrants et des semences pour entretenir : 1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village à LOUTANA et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 165 000 FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains
texts.en:
The group Benkadi A is made up of  ten married women. They are on average 30 years old and have an average of 6 children each. They all live in polygamous families in Maaro, a village located about 45 km from Sikasso, 3rd administrative district of Mali.

They are working with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their fifth loan with Soro Yiriwaso. The previous loans were fully repaid. The crops grown are rice and groundnuts. Madame Alimata, standing , middle, plans to pay for plowing costs and to buy inputs and groundnuts seeds for 1.5 hectares of land. After the harvest, the crops are sold at the village of Loutanna and at the Sikasso market to customers who are both men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 165,000 CFA francs at the end of the season. The profit will allow her to repay the loan and help her husband with everyday expenses. Alimata hopes to continue working with Soro Yiriwaso so that she can have more land for farming, which will lead to more profit.

loans.use: to buy inputs and seeds and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a determined businesswoman aged 39. She is married and blessed with four children. For the last six years, she has been managing a retail shop. She has employed two people to help her to run the business. In the next five years, she wants to expand the business. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy rice and sugar. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has become financially stable.

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Elvusal

texts.ru: Elvusal 21 qod. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Elvusal yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Shushi, seychas projivayet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey mamoy. Elvusal uje 2 qoda kak rabotayet taxistom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya svoyey mashini chtobi pochinit yeyo tak kak on ne mojet rabotat poka yego taxi  ne pochinitsya.
texts.en: Elvusal is 21 years old.  He is single and does not have children.  Elvusal is an IDP (Internally Displace Person), who moved from Shushi and now lives in the Baku region with his mother.  He has been working as a taxi driver for two years.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN to buy auto parts for his car in order to repair it because he cannot continue working until his car is fixed.

loans.use: to buy auto parts

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a hard-working businesswoman aged 37. For the last two years, she has been managing a salon to make a living. She has retained her business for two years because she has been trained in business management skills through the training conducted by Faulu Kenya.  In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy hair braids and combs.

loans.use: To buy hair braids and combs.

loans.name: Benkadi B Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe BENKADI  B sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à MAARO, un village situé à environ 45 km de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième cycle prêt avec l’institution et tous les prêts antérieurs ont été  remboursés sans aucune difficulté.
La spéculation cultivée par la groupe en l'occurrence par Madame KADIA  debout au milieu, est essentiellement  l’arachide.
Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labours, acheter des intrants et la semence pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village à LOUTANA et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 80.000 FCFA  en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the BENKADI B group are married women who have an average age of 32 years and 3 children. They live for the most part in polygamous families in MAARO, a village located 45 km away from Sikasso, the 3rd largest administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to continue their agricultural activities during the winter season. This is the 5th loan they have requested from the institution; all previous loans were reimbursed without any difficulties. Mrs KADIA, who is standing in the middle of the back row in the photograph, is a good representative of the group. She plans to use this loan to cover labor costs and purchases of fertilizer and seeds for 1 acre of land.
Good produced are sold at the neighboring village of LOUTANA and at the SIKASSO market to a client base of men and women. She hopes to obtain profits of 80,000 FCFA (approximately 176 USD) at the end of the season, which will enable her to pay back her loan as well as help her husband cover daily living expenses.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer and cover costs of labor and seeds

loans.name: Tobias

texts.en:
Tobias is a focused businessman aged 32. He is single. For the last two years, he has been operating a m-pesa (mobile-phone money transfer business), photocopying and a printing business to earn a living. In the next five years, he wants to open another outlet of his business. 

He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy printing paper. Thanks to Faulu Kenya,he has become financially stable.

loans.use: To buy printing paper.

loans.name: Benkadi  C Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres que constituent le groupe BENKADI C sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à MAARO, un village situé à environ 45 km de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième cycle prêt avec l’institution. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le riz et l’arachide  avec Madame AFOU  assise au milieu.
Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et des semences pour entretenir : 0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village à LOUTANA et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25.000 FCFA  en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
BENKADI C is a group made up of 10 married women with an average age of 32 and who have, on average, 3 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in a village called Maaro, which is located about 45 kms from the town of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
The group joined the loan program of the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This will be their 5th loan cycle with the institution. Their previous loans have all been fully repaid.
Afou (sitting, in the middle of the picture) grows rice and groudnuts. She will use her part of the loan to buy the farm inputs and seeds she needs for her 0.5 hectare of farmland, and pay the labourers. The harvest will be sold in the village of Loutana and at the market of Sikasso. By the end of the season she should have made a profit of around 25 000 FCFA, with which she plans to pay back her loan and help her husband with the daily household expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Paimpai

texts.en:
Paimpai is 26 years old and married to Jeniffer. They are blessed with two children  aged four years and nine months. He has been selling milk for the past three years. He has been loaned KES 30,000 which he plans to use to purchase dairy cows.

With the anticipated profit made he plans to open a dairy, and in the near future he hope to supply KENYA CREAMERIES COMPANY with milk.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 36 years old, married and with three children in school.  To earn a living, she does dairy farming.  She has been in the business for 15 years.  Previously, she was employed.  She managed to go into farming after getting capital from Faulu Kenya. 
 
In five years, she hopes to have more cows in her farm for more milk production.  She has requested a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Benkadi D Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI  D est composé de sept membres, lors de la prise de photo, la nommée  MATENIN DOULAYE venait d’accoucher. C’est la raison pour la quelle elle ne figure sur la photo du groupe.
Le groupe est formé par des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à MAARO, un village situé à environ 45 km de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième cycle prêt avec l’institution. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement rembourser.
La spéculation cultivée est : le riz et l’arachide  avec Madame AFOU ADAMA deuxième debout à gauche.
Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et des semences pour entretenir : 0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village à LOUTANA et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 33.000 FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Group BENKADI D is made up of seven members. When the picture was taken, MATENIN DOULAYE had just given birth, which is why she's not in the photograph of the group.

The members of the group are married women who average 32 years of age and 3 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in MAARO, a village located approximately 45 km from the city of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with Kiva's partner, the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry on their farming businesses during the rainy season. They are seeking their fifth loan, and the previous ones were repaid without problems.

AFOU ADAMA (second one standing on the left) grows rice and peanuts. With her loan, she intends to buy fertilizers and seeds for her 0.5-hectare land lot. Following the harvest, the production is sold in the village, in Loutana, and at the market in Sikasso, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

AFOU ADAMA intends to turn an average profit of XOF 33'000 (ca US$ 68) at the end of the farming cycle, to be used to repay the loan and help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Sabougnouma A Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA A sont des hommes tous  cultivateurs de maïs du village de Zoloko, dans la commune urbaine de Sikasso. Ils  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, ont moyenne  35 ans et   5 enfants. Le village Zoloko est situé à environ 19 km de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Ces hommes sont à leur premier cycle de prêt aux producteurs de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils produisent du maïs depuis plusieurs années et cette activité est d’une rentabilité sans pareille  pour eux.
Monsieur OUMAR,  debout au milieu, en chemise blanche est le président du groupe, avec son prêt il compte payer les frais de labours, acheter des intrants et de la semence pour entretenir : 1.5 hectares de maïs. 
La production est gardée pendant un certains temps, avant d’être vendue au niveau du village de Loutana et au marché de Sikasso, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de commerçants venant de grandes villes telles Sikasso, Bamako, etc. 
OUMAR espère réaliser un bénéfice de 185.000 FCFA  en fin de  campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi l’aider à entretenir sa famille.
texts.en:
The 10 men who make up the Sabougnouma A group are all corn farmers in the village of Zoloko, in the urban area of Sikasso.  They live in large traditional families, and they are an average of 35 years old with five children.  The village of Zoloko is about 19 km (12 mi)  from the city of Sikasso, in the 3rd administrative region of the republic of Mali.

These men are on their first loan cycle as corn farmers with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, in order to keep their farming business productive during the rainy season.  They have been producing corn for several years, and for them it is an unparalleled business in terms of profitability.

Oumar, who is standing in the middle in a white shirt, is the group’s president.  He plans on using his loan to pay costs of labor, and to purchase farm input and seeds to maintain 1.5 hectares (about 3.5 acres) of corn fields.  

The crop is stored for awhile before being sold in the village of Loutana and at the Sikasso market, to a clientele made up mostly of salespeople from large cities like Sikasso, Bamako, etc.

Oumar hopes to make a profit of 185,000 CFA francs at the end of the growing season.

This profit will enable him to pay off his loan and also to help cover his family’s expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm input and seeds and to pay costs of labor

loans.name: Richard

texts.fr:
Client de 27 ans, célibataire sans enfant, il  se lance dans le commerce en 2002, quand il arrête ses études en classe de troisième,situe dans un quartier populaire , il a une forte clientèle  il vend en moyenne 50.000 frs a 120.000frs par jour, il vend tous les jours du matin jusqu'au soir.
A l'octroi de son prêt il va acheter des produits d'alimentation  et des produits cosmétiques.
Tres pragmatique il a l'intention d'ouvrir une grande boutique et faire de la vente en gros et demi gros de ces produits.Il veut beaucoup epargner pour satisfaire a ses ambitions.
texts.en:
Richard, age 27, is single and without children. In 2002, he dropped out of his last year of middle school, and started his own business. Being located in a popular neighborhood, he has a large clientele. His daily sales amount to XOF 50'000 to 120'000 (ca US$ 100 to 250) and he sells everyday from morning to evening.

With his loan, he will buy food products and cosmetics. Very pragmatical, he intends to open a large shop to sell his products wholesale and half wholesale. He wants to put money away in order to fulfill his ambitions.

loans.use: to buy boxes of tomatos, canned food, and cosmetics

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a businessman aged 35. He is married and blessed with one child. For the last four years, he has been selling stationery and providing printing and photocopying services. He also works as a taxi driver to earn more income for his family.

 In the next five years, he wants to have a well-established business. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy a lamination machine. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become business-oriented.

loans.use: To buy a lamination machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita de cincuenta años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo. Ella posee una tortillería la cual le ayuda a mantener a flote su hogar, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las tortillas que prepara Felicita son inigualables siempre calientitas y con el servicio más rápido del lugar, además tienen un precio realmente bajo; Felicita es una mujer muy trabajadora con muchos propósitos por alcanzar, para ella la confianza y dedicación en lo que te gusta hacer, son el secreto de un éxito futuro. Quiere ver crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicito a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor , aceite y gas propano para así siempre producir la cantidad demandada y no decepcionar a la clientela. Felicita tiene fe que su trabajo le dará la oportunidad de darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Felicita, who is 50 years old, lives with her life partner and her son.

She has a tortilla shop, which helps her to keep her household afloat. Felicita has recently gotten many customers because the tortillas she makes are without equal, always piping hot and with the fastest service in the area. They are also sold at a very low price.

Felicita is a very hardworking woman with many goals to reach. For her, confidence and dedication to what you like to do are the secret to future success. She wants to see her business grow, and this is why she asked INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy corn wholesale, oil and propane gas. This way, she can always produce the amount in demand and not disappoint her customers. 

Felicita has faith that her work will give her the opportunity to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale, oil and propane gas.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a hardworking businessman aged 46. He is married and blessed with five children. For the last six years, he has operating a greengrocer to earn a living. In the next five years, he wants to become the supplier of groceries to his region. His dream is to venture into crop farming. He is requesting a loan  of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy vegetables.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Tomas Alberto

texts.es: Tomas Alberto de sesenta y cuatro años de edad vive con sus hijos. El posee un taller de carpintería en el lugar de su residencia, elabora diferentes tipos de muebles: camas, roperos, mesas, sillas, tocadores entre otros. Tomas tiene un don, todo su trabajo le queda excelente les da un toque especial gracias a su dedicación en cada obra, con diferentes estilos y siempre al gusto del cliente, últimamente ha tenido más demanda pues su trabajo es de muy buena calidad y da precios cómodos, además les da un servicio excelente; Tomas Alberto es un hombre de decisiones y con ganas de salir adelante siempre tiene la energía  de seguir trabajando para ver crecer el negocio, es por eso que le ha solicitado a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar madera por mayor, de calides como el cedro, conacaste, caoba, laurel entre otras,  para seguir produciendo y aumentar sus ganancias. Tomas Alberto tiene confianza que con su trabajo mejorara su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Tomas Alberto is 64 years old, and lives with his children.  He has a carpentry workshop in his place of residence, where he makes different types of furniture: beds, wardrobes, tables, chairs, and dressing tables, among other things.  Tomas has a gift; all his work is excellent with his special touch, thanks to his dedication to every piece, in different styles and always to the customer's taste.  Recently, he has had increased demand, as his work is of such good quality and reasonably priced.  He also provides excellent service.

Tomas Alberto is a decisive man who, with his desire to move ahead in life, always has the energy to continue working to see his business grow.  This is why he has requested a loan from INTEGRAL.  It will allow him to buy wood at wholesale, from trees such as cedar, elephant ear tree, mahogany and laurel among others.  This will allow him to continue his production and increase his earnings.

Tomas Alberto has confidence that through his work, he can improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wood at wholesale, from trees such as cedar, elephant ear trees, mahogany, and laurel among others.

loans.name: Dora Concepción

texts.es: Dora Concepción D. sesenta y un años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida  y sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una tienda muy visitada por las personas D. la zona, ya son muchos años D. experiencia en este negocio y la clientela siempre encuentra en su negocio lo que necesitan,  además sus productos son D. buena calidad y los venD. a precios accesibles; Dora Concepcion a pesar D. que es una mujer D. avanzada edad no se detiene por ninguna circunstancia siempre se encuentra muy activa y con ganas D. seguir trabajando, el secreto en su negocio es la perseverancia y el amor con que ella lo realiza; quiere ver crecer su pequeño negocio por eso se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar producto para surtir la tienda como granos básicos, golosinas, pan, condimentos entre otros. Dora concepción tiene fe que con su esfuerzo en el trabajo lograra llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Concepción, 61, lives with her life partner and children in her own house.  She has a store that’s very popular with local residents.  She has quite a few years’ experience with this business now and her customers always find what they need in her store.  Besides, her products are of good quality and she sells them at affordable prices.  

Despite her advanced age, Concepción doesn’t stop for anything; she’s always busy with a desire to keep working.  The secret to her business is perseverance and the love she puts into it.  

She wants to see her small business grow and this is why she decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan that will make it possible for her to buy merchandise like basic grains, snacks, bread and condiments, among others to stock the store.  Concepción trusts that with her effort at work she will bring economic security and a better life to her home.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 58 years old and married.  To earn a living, he rears pigs.  He also does dairy farming to supplement his income.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business hence improving his standard of living.
  
David hopes to grow his business further so that he can generate more income.  He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy more pigs.

loans.use: To buy more pigs.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es: Juan José de cincuenta y siete años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y su nieto. El posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad arroz, frijoles, pan, leche entre otros, su tienda es muy visitada en la localidad pues Don Juan siempre tiene lo que necesitan con productos de excelente calidad a precios cómodos, además les ofrece un servicio excelente; Juan José es un hombre emprendedor con ganas de salir adelante para él la mejor forma de conseguir la realización personal es por medio de la dedicación y el esfuerzo en el trabajo sin dejar atrás la alegría, quiere ver crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar productos para surtir su tienda como granos básicos, bebidas, producto instantáneo, condimentos, aceites, embutidos etc. Juan José tiene la esperanza que su labor le dará la oportunidad de darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan José, 57, lives with his life partner and grandson.  He has a store where he sells basic need items: beans, rice, bread and milk, among others.  His store is very popular with locals because Juan always has what they need: excellent quality products at affordable prices.  Besides, he provides excellent service.  

Juan José is an enterprising man who wants to get ahead.  For him, the best way to reach his personal goals is through dedication and effort at work without forgetting about being happy.  

He wants to see his business grow so is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will make it possible for him to buy products like basic grains, beverages, instant products, condiments, oil, cured meats, etc. to stock his store.  Juan José hopes that his work will provide him with the opportunity to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Félix Humberto

texts.es: Félix Humberto de de cuarenta y cinco años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijos. El posee un comedor, vende ricos almuerzos todos los días, Félix es un gran cocinero prepara platillos exquisitos para el deleite de sus clientes a precios muy accesibles, la comida es de muy buena calidad y el lugar es muy higiénico además el servicio que les ofrece es inigualable; Félix es un hombre de metas, quiere ver crecer su negocio y mantenerse siempre adelante de la competencia, para él la disciplina y la constancia en el trabajo son el mejor amigo del hombre porque permiten que realices tus mas grandes propósitos, es así como se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, carnes, verduras, embutidos condimentos entre otros, para satisfacer las necesidades de la clientela. Félix Humberto tiene fe que con su esfuerzo le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Félix Humberto is 45 years old, and lives with his life companion and children.  He has a diner where he sells rich lunches every day.  Félix is a great cook who makes exquisite dishes for the delight of his customers, at very affordable prices.  The food is of very good quality, and the premises are very hygienic; also, the service that he provides is incomparable.

Félix is a man with goals.  He wants to grow his business and keep himself always moving ahead of the competition.  For him, discipline and constancy in work are the best friends of a man, because they allow him to realize all his grand plans.  

This is why he decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan which will allow him to buy bulk grains, meat, vegetables, sausages, condiments and other things, to meet his customers' needs.

Félix Humberto has faith that with his efforts, he will give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains, meat, vegetables, sausages, and condiments.

loans.name: Irma Emely

texts.es: Irma Emely de veintiocho años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hija menor de edad. Vive en casa de su suegra. Ella posee en la misma casa y también de forma ambulante una venta de ropa de todo tipo y estilo para damas, caballeros, niños y niñas, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues Irma siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de muy buena calidad y a un precio realmente accesible además el servicio es excelente, ella siempre recibe a las personas con el mejor de los gustos; Irma es una mujer de propósitos llena de energía y constancia en el trabajo para ella la mejor forma de llegar al éxito y tener felicidad es dedicándose al trabajo con amor y alegría es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar blusas, vestidos, pantalones, camisetas, trajes entre otros. Irma Emely tiene la confianza que de esta forma lograra darle a su familia seguridad económica y una vida plena
texts.en:
Irma Emely, 28, lives with her life partner and minor daughter.  She lives in her mother-in-law’s house.  She sells clothes at home and also as a street vendor.  She sells all types of clothes for women, men, boys and girls.  Lately she’s acquired quite a number of customers because Irma always meets their needs with very good quality products and a really affordable price.  Besides, service is excellent; she always welcomes her customers with a good disposition.

Irma is a woman full of goals, energy and perseverance at work.  For her, the best way to be successful and to be happy is to dedicate herself to work with love and joy.  This is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to purchase blouses, dresses, pants, t-shirts and outfits, among others.  Irma Emely trusts that she will be able to provide economic security and a full life to her family this way.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse has operated his auto garage for the last ten years.  He is 47 years old, married to Priscah, and they have two school children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan.  He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy spray paint and spanners for his garage.

In future, he hopes to grow his garage and be a one-stop, where he can do everything at his place.

loans.use: To buy  spray paint and spanners.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more cattle for rearing and selling.

loans.name: Lukas

texts.en:
Lukas is 29 years, married to Ann, and they are not yet blessed with children. He has been operating his transport business for the last five years, making a monthly profit of KES 30,000. This is his third loan and he plans to have his motorcycle repaired.

With the anticipated profit made he hopes to purchase another motorcycle. In the near future he hopes to own a mini bus.

loans.use: to have the motorcycle repaired.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa de Jesús de treinta y seis años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos. Ella posee una venta de comida en el lugar donde reside, es muy conocida en el lugar pues prepara los platillos más exquisitos de la zona desayunos y almuerzos, todo a un precio accesible y de muy buena calidad, además el lugar es higiénico y el servicio excelente, el cliente siempre queda satisfecho y con una sonrisa en el rostro; Teresa es una mujer emprendedora se levanta desde muy temprano para comenzar su labor para ella el secreto de su trabajo es el sazón de sus comidas y amor con el que las prepara, quiere ver crecer el negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, carnes, embutidos, lácteos, huevos, verduras entre otros. Teresa de Jesús tiene la confianza que su esfuerzo le permitirá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús, 36, lives with her life partner and two children.  She sells food at home.  She’s very well known locally because she makes the most delicious dishes in the zone:  breakfasts and dinners at very affordable prices and of very good quality.  Besides, the place is very hygienic and service is excellent; the customer is always satisfied and leaves smiling.

Teresa is an enterprising woman who rises very early every day to start her work.  For her, the secret of her work is the tastiness of her dishes and the love she prepares them with.  

She wants to see her business grow so has asked INTEGRAL for a loan that will make it possible for her to buy basic grains, meats, cured meats, dairy products, eggs and vegetables, among others.  Teresa de Jesús trusts that her effort will allow her to provide a full life for her family.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meats, cured meats, dairy products, eggs and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start building rental houses on his other piece of land.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael has operated his retail shop in Naivasha town for the last three years.  He is 37 years old, married to Priscilla, and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy more goods like sugar, flour, salt, etc. to sell in his retail shop.

In future, Michael hopes to grow his retail shop to wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell like sugar, flour, salt, etc.

loans.name: Rubenia Dolores

texts.es: Rubenia Dolores de cincuenta y cuatro años de edad vive con su compañero de vida en casa propia. Ella posee un puesto de frutas en un lugar estratégico cerca de un hospital tiene mucha clientela pues el lugar es bastante concurrido por las personas, su fruta es conocida en el lugar pues siempre está fresca, es muy higiénica la venta, tiene precio accesible y el servicio es excelente;  Rubenia es una mujer decidida y con ganas de salir adelante el secreto en su trabajo es la constancia y satisfacer al cliente, piensa que solo así se puede llegar al éxito, es con ese pensamiento que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar sandia, piña, jocotes, fresas, mangos, guayabas entre otros. Rubenia Dolores tiene confianza que de esta forma logrará llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Rubenia Dolores, 54, lives with her life partner in her own house. She has a fruit stand in a strategic place near a hospital and has many customers because the street is very busy. She is well known in the area because her fruit is always fresh and clean, her prices are reasonable and the service is excellent.

Rubenia is a determined woman who wants to get ahead. The secret of her work is the loyalty and satisfaction of her customers. She believes that is the only way she can succeed. With that thought in mind, she decided to request a loan from Integral that allows her to buy watermelon, pineapple, coconuts, strawberries, mangos and guavas, among other items.  Rubenia Dolores is confident that in this way she can insure that her household has financial security.

loans.use: to buy watermelon, pineapple, coconut, strawberries, mangos and guavas.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a businessman aged 39, married and blessed with four children. For the last 15 years, he has been operating a business selling second-hand clothes to earn a living. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 80,000 to buy clothes. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to operate his business through his previous loan.

loans.use: To buy used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Orbelina Esperanza

texts.es: Orbelina Esperanza de veintisiete años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos en casa propia. Ella vende productos enchapado o con recubrimiento de oro, como cadenas o pulseras y también vende productos de belleza por catalogo; se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente pues todo lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y claro lo vende a un buen precio, además Orbelina siempre está a la expectativa de los clientes y les ofrece el servicio que se merecen; es una mujer emprendedora siempre dispuesta para el trabajo para ella trazar un objetivo, una meta, un blanco, sirven para determinar la acción de su próximo paso y obtener el resultado de mañana. Su objetivo es ver crecer el negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mayor cantidad y variedad de cadenas, pulseras, anillos, aritos, entre otros. Orbelina Esperanza tiene la fe que con todo su esfuerzo en el trabajo logrará darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Orbelina Esperanza, 27, lives with her life partner and three children in her own house.  She sells gold plated products like chains or bracelets.  She also sells beauty products via catalogue.  She’s acquired quite a large clientele recently because everything she sells is of very good quality and, of course, she sells it at a very good price.  Besides, Orbelina is always on the lookout for customers and she gives them the service they deserve.

She is an enterprising woman always willing to work.  For her, setting objectives, goals or targets helps her to determine her next step to obtain tomorrow’s result.  

Her objective is to see her business grow so she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy larger amounts and variety of chains, bracelets, rings and hoops, among others.  Orbelina Esperanza hopes that all of her effort at work will allow her to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy chains, bracelets, rings and hoops.

loans.name: Martha Lucia

texts.es:
En municipio de Managua, la señora Martha Lucia se dedica arduamente  a laborar como contadora en la Universidad, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace Veinte años. Es casada y con tres personas a su cargo que le proporciona las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen.

La señora Martha Lucia ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar la condición de su vivienda en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como bloque, cemento, arena, por medio de esta obra brindarle mejor condición de vida a su familia, para poder hacer un anexo de un cuarto.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Managua, Señora Martha Lucia works extremely hard as an accountant at the University, a job she has done for twenty years. She is married and has three dependents to whom she provides the necessary means for their development.

Señora Martha Lucia has turned to Ceprodel to request a loan to buy construction materials such as cinder blocks, cement and sand to improve the condition of her home and to construct a one room extension, thus providing better living conditions for her family .

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia has practiced farming for the last six years.  She is 54 years old, married to Peter and they have three school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Sophia hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Porfiria

texts.es: Porfiria de treinta y ocho años de edad vive con sus dos pequeños hijos. Ella es costurera y tiene su taller en el lugar de su residencia, es muy conocida en el lugar ya que confecciona ropa muy bonita, Porfiria tiene un don, siempre está a la vanguardia creando nuevos estilos para el gusto de su clientela desde lo mas simple hasta lo mas exigente en: blusas, faldas, vestidos para eventos especiales, camisas, trajes, entre otros, todo de muy buena calidad y a precio accesible además el servicio que ofrece es inigualable, Porfiria es muy amable para ella el lema en su trabajo es al cliente lo que pida; últimamente han aumentado sus pedidos de ropa y eso la impulso a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar telas por mayor de diferentes estilos, sierres, hilos, agujas etc. Porfiria tiene confianza que de esta forma logrará darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Porfiria, 38, lives with her two small children. She is a seamstress and has her workshop in her residence. She is well-known in the area since she makes very lovely clothing.

Porfiria is a talented seamstress. She is always avant-garde, creating new styles, from the simplest to the most complicated, according to her customer’s taste, in blouses, skirts, special-occasion dresses, shirts, suits, among others, all of very good quality and at a reasonable price. Moreover, the service she offers is unparalleled.

Porfiro is very friendly. Her motto in her work is:"Whatever the client wants." Recently her clothing orders have increased and this prompted her to request a loan from Integral that will allow her to buy different styles of fabric wholesale, fasteners, thread, needles, etc. Porfiria is confident that in this way she will be able to give her family a fuller life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, fasteners, thread, needles.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a determined businesswoman aged 28 and she is single. For the last six years, she has been managing a salon to make a living. In the next five years, she wants to establish her business in many branches. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy cosmetics. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save the income she earns.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles has been extracting stones from quarries for the last thirty years.  He is 51 years old, married to Wanjiru, and they have six school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to pay for labor and buy more working tools like wheelbarrows, shovels, mallets, etc.

In future, he hopes to own many quarries.

loans.use: to pay for labor and buy more working tools like wheelbarrows, shovels, mallets, etc.

loans.name: Ada Elsy

texts.es: Ada Elsy de treinta años de edad vive con sus dos hijos menores. Ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, la cual le ayuda a sostener los gastos de su hogar, su tienda es la más surtida del lugar, los clientes siempre encuentran lo que necesitan, con productos de muy buena calidad y a precios realmente accesibles; Ada Elsy es una mujer con un carisma increíble, siempre esta alegre y se lo transmite a cada persona que visita la tienda;  quiere ver crecer su negocio y para ella no hay un imposible que la deje abandonar su sueño, es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, bebidas, productos instantáneos, aceite, embutidos, jabones entre otros. Ada Elsy tiene fe que con su trabajo logrará darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ada Elsy, aged 30, lives with her two young children.  She has a store where she sells everyday items, which helps her to cover her household expenses. Her store is the best stocked in the neighborhood; her customers always find what they need, and she offers very good quality products at affordable prices.

Ada Elsy is a woman with incredible charisma; she is always happy and this comes across to every person who visits her store.  She wants to see her business grow, and there is nothing that will make her abandon her dream.  This is why she decided to to request a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy bulk grains, candy, drinks, instant foods, oil, sausages, and soap among other things.

Ada Elsy has faith that with her work, she will be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains, candy, drinks, instant foods, oil, sausages, and soap.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 26 years old, single, and he has been operating his personal products sales business for the last seven years, making a monthly profit of KES.15,000. This is his fifth loan and he plans to add more stock like mosquito nets, hair extensions, etc. for sale.

With the anticipated profit made he plans to save and diversify into another business. In the near future he hopes to own a "matatu" (public transport vehicle).

loans.use: to add more stock  like mosquito nets, hair extensions, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Crista Isabel

texts.es: Crista Isabel D. cuarenta y seis años D. edad vive con sus tres hijos menores D. edad que asisten a la escuela que se encuentra cerca D. donD. residen. Ella posee una panadería muy conocida en la localidad pues Crista prepara el pan más exquisito D. la zona, prepara diversidad D. pan como pastelitos, cachos, quesadillas, peperechas entre otros, y todo lo venD. a un buen precio además el servicio es excelente, Crista siempre está con una sonrisa en el rostro pues la alegría es su secreto en el trabajo, últimamente ha aumentado su demanda y quiere elaborar mas pan para siempre estar al frente D. la competencia y no decepcionar a los clientes es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar materia prima harina, azúcar, jaleas, colorantes, levadura, algunas bandejas entre otros. Crista Isabel tiene la esperanza que D. esta forma logrará llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
46-year-old Crista Isabel lives with her three dependent children who attend a school near their home.  Crista owns a bakery which is very well known in her town as she makes the most delicious bread in her area.  She makes a range of different breads and pastries such as 'pastelitos' and 'cachos' (filled pastries), quesadillas and 'peperechas' (a traditional sweet bread).  She sells all of her products at a good price and provides excellent customer service.  Crista always has a smile on her lips.  Her cheerfulness is her traD. secret.

Lately, Crista has seen her demand increase and she would like to make more breads and pastries so that she can always be ahead of the competition and avoid disappointing her customers.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy raw materials such as flour, sugar, jelly, dyes, yeast and some trays.  Crista hopes that this will enable her to proviD. her household with financial security.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, jelly, dyes and yeast

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last four years. She is 50 years old and married to Charles. They have four school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan. She repaid her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan to buy a dairy cow.

In the future, Mary hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Patricia Del Carmen

texts.es: Patricia del Carmen D. treinta y cuatro años D. edad vive con sus dos hijos los cuales aun asisten a la escuela. Ella posee una tienda donD. venD. todo tipo D. productos D. primera necesidad y quiere empezar a comerciar producto escolar, su tienda es muy visitada por las personas D. la localidad pues ahí siempre encuentran lo que necesitan con buenos precios y excelente servicio; Patricia es una mujer muy carismática y emprendedora para ella el camino hacia el éxito se vuelve corto si trabaja con el corazón, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, pan, golosinas, bebidas, cuadernos,cartulinas, cromos, lápices entre otros. Patricia del Carmen quiere llenar a su familia D. felicidad y espera en un futuro darles una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Patricia del Carmen is 34 years old, and lives with her two children are are still at school.

She has a store where she sells all kinds of everyday products, and she wants to begin to sell school products.  Her store is frequented by local people, as they can always find what they need at good prices and with excellent service.  

Patricia is a very charismatic and enterprising women; for her, the path to success is shortened if you work with your heart.  This is why she is asking INTEGRAL for the loan, which will allow her to buy bulk grains, bread, candy, drinks, notebooks, cards, stickers and pencils among other things.

Patricia Carmen wants to bring her family happiness, and hopes to proviD. them with a better quality of life in the future.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains, bread, candy, drinks, notebooks, pencils.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 12 years. She is 39 years old and married to Murage. They have six school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Agnes hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 49 years old, married and has five children in school.  

She has been operating a grocery store and a retail shop for over ten years. She has been able to retain the business through the financial support of Faulu Kenya.
  
In five years, she hopes to expand her business into wholesale. She needs a loan of 60,000 KES to buy cooking fat, sugar, tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, sugar, tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.name: Beta Finance Investments Group

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Masimba from Masvingo province in Zimbabwe. He is married and has two children, one going to school. 

Masimba is in the hardware business and he sells electrical gadgets and nails. He has been in this business for four years. 

Masimba has requested a loan of $400 to buy electrical gadgets, nails and glues. He says the main challenge he faces is the lack of funding to supply big orders. The loan will now help him increase his business capacity. 

He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will go towards school fees and food for the family. In the future Masimba sees himself  owning a hardware shop.

loans.use: To buy electrical gadgets, nails and glue for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es: María Luisa D. cincuenta y seis años D. edad vive con su hijo. Ella venD. ropa D. forma ambulante en diferentes zonas cercanas a la localidad donD. resiD., María venD. todo tipo D. ropa y D. diferentes estilos para damas, caballeros, niños y niñas como faldas blusas, pantalones entre otros; se ha hecho D. mucha clientela después D. años dedicados a esta actividad; últimamente ha notado un incremento en sus ventas dado que a aperturado nuevas zonas D. venta vendiendo a un precio muy accesible, su atención es inigualable; María Luisa es una mujer con ganas D. salir adelante para ella el triunfo surge D. la voluntad y el empeño que se le pone al trabajo, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa faldas, pantalones, blusas, camisetas etc y satisfacer la demanda D. los nuevos lugares descubiertos que en su mayoria son cantones o caserios es decir lugares en su mayoria rurales y muy alejados D. las ciudades, donD. incluso el transporte es limitado. María Luisa tiene la confianza que D. esta forma logrará darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
María Luisa is 56 years old, and lives with her son.  She sells clothes as a street vendor in different areas close to where she lives.  María sells all types of clothes in different styles for women, men, boys and girls, such as skirts, blouses, and trousers among other things.  She has many customers after her years working in this business.  Recently, she has noticed an increase in her sales, as she has started selling in new areas.  She has affordable prices, and her level of service is incomparable.

María Luisa is a woman with the desire to get ahead in life.  For her, victory comes from the will and commitment that you put into your work.  This is why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy skirts, trousers, blouses, T-shirts, etc. In this way, she can meet the demand from her newly discovered sales locations which are mainly cantons or hamlets, that is to say places that are mainly rural and far away from the cities, where even transportation is limited.

María Luisa has confidence that in this way she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy skirts, trousers, blouses, and T-shirts.

loans.name: Maritza Estella

texts.es:
